original: de la gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa thog ma bltams nas phyogs bcur gom pa bdun bdun gshegs par yid mi ches na /
analyzed: de la gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa thog ma bltams nas phyogs bcur gom pa bdun bdun gshegs par yid mi ches na /
translated: Whoever does not believe that the Tathāgata, after his birth, took seven steps in each of the ten directions,

original: de ni bdud kyis bstan pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bdud kyis bstan pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: has entered into the teaching of Māra.

original: de la gang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung nas phyogs bcur gom pa bdun bdun gshegs te /
analyzed: de la gang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung nas phyogs bcur gom pa bdun bdun gshegs te /
translated: Whoever says that the Tathāgata, after appearing in the world, took seven steps in each of the ten directions,

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas thabs su bstan pa yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas thabs su bstan pa yin no zhes smra na /
translated: and that this was taught by the Tathāgata as a skillful means,

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i mdo sde dang / 'dul ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i mdo sde dang / 'dul ba yin no //
translated: has entered into the sūtras and the Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata.

original: de la gang bdud kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang bdud kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Whoever follows the teaching of Māra is said to belong to the class of Māra.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Whoever follows the teaching of the Buddha is said to be a bodhisattva.

original: de la gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' thog ma btsas nas rgyal po yab kyis lha'i rten la phyag 'tshal du khrid pa na phyir lha rnams kyis mthong ma thag tu phyag byas te; de bas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' thog ma btsas nas rgyal po yab kyis lha'i rten la phyag 'tshal du khrid pa na phyir lha rnams kyis mthong ma thag tu phyag byas te; de bas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: If someone were to ask, “Why is he called Buddha?,” you should say, “When the Bodhisattva was first born, his father the king took him to the temple of the gods. As soon as the gods saw him, they bowed down to him. Therefore he is called Buddha.”

original: de la gang zhig 'di skad du lha zhes bya ba sngar byung ste /
analyzed: de la gang zhig 'di skad du lha zhes bya ba sngar byung ste /
translated: “If someone were to argue, ‘The gods came first,

original: sangs rgyas ni 'phyi na ci'i phyir lha rnams kyis sangs rgyas la bsti stang dang phyag byed ces de skad du rgol na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni 'phyi na ci'i phyir lha rnams kyis sangs rgyas la bsti stang dang phyag byed ces de skad du rgol na /
translated: and the Buddha came later. Why then do the gods pay homage to the Buddha?’

original: de ni bdud sdig to can gyis bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bdud sdig to can gyis bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that this is the teaching of the evil Māra.

original: de la gang zhig 'di skad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lha'i rten du gshegs pa na dbang @159a *//
analyzed: de la gang zhig 'di skad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lha'i rten du gshegs pa na dbang @159a *//
translated: “If someone were to ask, ‘When the Buddha, the Blessed One, went to the temple of the gods,🔽the great Īśvara, the great Brahmā, Śakra, lord of the gods, and all the gods put their palms together

original: sgyur chen po dang / tshangs pa chen po dang / brgya byin lha'i dbang phyug la sogs pa lha thams cad kyis thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: sgyur chen po dang / tshangs pa chen po dang / brgya byin lha'i dbang phyug la sogs pa lha thams cad kyis thal mo sbyar te /

analyzed: bsti stang dang bcas pas zhabs la phyag byas so zhes mdo sde dang / 'dul ba las byung na /
translated: If it is found in the sutras and vinaya,

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'o //

original: de la gang bdud kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug na /
analyzed: de la gang bdud kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug na /

translated: then one is said to belong to the class of Mara.

original: de la gang sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de la gang sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni /
translated: If one follows the teaching of the Buddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: then one is said to be a bodhisattva.

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba gang las byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab mdzad pa na 'dod pa'i sems kyis phyogs bzhi nas btsun mo btsal te /
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba gang las byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab mdzad pa na 'dod pa'i sems kyis phyogs bzhi nas btsun mo btsal te /
translated: If it is found in the sutras and vinaya that when the bodhisattva was serving as regent, he sought out queens from the four directions with a lustful mind,

analyzed: pho brang gi nang du 'dod pa rnam pa lnga bde bar spyod do zhes mdo sde dang / 'dul ba las 'byung na /
translated: and that he enjoyed the five sense pleasures within the palace,

original: de ni bdud kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdud kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: then it is the teaching of Mara.

original: de la gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' yun ring po nas 'dod pa'i sems dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi 'dod pa yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: de la gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' yun ring po nas 'dod pa'i sems dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi 'dod pa yongs su spangs te /
translated: Whoever, for a long time, abandons the mind of desire and the desires of the harem,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha'i 'dod pa lnga'ang mchil ma bzhin du bor na mi'i 'dod pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha'i 'dod pa lnga'ang mchil ma bzhin du bor na mi'i 'dod pa lta ci smos te /

original: skra dang kha spu bregs nas khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs nas khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu byung ste /
translated: Shaving off hair and beard, they go forth from home into homelessness.🔽They practice diligently for awakening.

analyzed: byang chub la nan tan byed do zhes mdo sde dang / 'dul ba la de skad ces byung na /

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: de la gang bdud kyis @159b bstan pa'i mdo sde dang / 'dul ba'i rjes su 'jug pa ni bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who follow the sūtras and the Vinaya taught by Māra are said to belong to the class of Māra.

analyzed: de la gang sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i mdo sde dang / 'dul ba'i rjes su 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //

translated: If it were said in the sūtras or vinaya that the Blessed One, out of great compassion and love for sentient beings, allowed the use of things such as large and small copper bowls and so on that are used to determine the sex of one’s parents, or that he allowed the use of things such as fields, farming, commerce, wheat, rice, and so on,

original: de ni bdud kyis bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: de la gang bdud kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //

original: zhes smra yang dge slong de ni phas pham pa byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes smra yang dge slong de ni phas pham pa byung ba ma yin no //
translated: ’ But that monk has not committed a root downfall.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / ngas ni phas pham pa bzhi las gcig tsam nyams na rdo bcag pa ltar phyir mi @164a *//

original: 'byor ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'byor ro zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: de la gang zhig bla ma mi'i chos thob bo zhes de skad smra na de ni phas pham pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: yang dag par ci'ang ma thob par thob pa ltar sgyu dang g-yo 'chos na gang zag de ni mi'i chos las nyams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par ci'ang ma thob par thob pa ltar sgyu dang g-yo 'chos na gang zag de ni mi'i chos las nyams pa zhes bya ste /

original: phas pham pa yin no //
analyzed: phas pham pa yin no //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dge slong gang zhig 'dod pa nyung ba /

original: chog shes pa /
analyzed: chog shes pa /

analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung ba /

analyzed: yongs su dag pa / bas mthar gnas pa'i drung du rgyal po'am /

original: blon po chen po 'ongs nas dge slong 'di ni dgra bcom par gyur to snyam bsams te drung du bsnyen nas bstod pa dang bsnyen bkur dang phyag byas te /
analyzed: blon po chen po 'ongs nas dge slong 'di ni dgra bcom par gyur to snyam bsams te drung du bsnyen nas bstod pa dang bsnyen bkur dang phyag byas te /

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /

original: slob dpon chen po /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po /

analyzed: lus 'di rjes ma thag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya'o //

analyzed: zhes smra na dge slong de rgyal po de la 'di skad ces smra'o //

analyzed: bdag ni yang dag par dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ma thob kyi /

analyzed: rgyal po chen po bdag la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob bo zhes ma gsung zhig /

analyzed: rgyal po chen po /

analyzed: bdag la chog mi shes pa'i chos bka' mi stsal du gsol /

analyzed: gang chog mi shes pa dag ni khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar du bstod kyang lan ma btab ste cang mi smra'o //
translated: Even if you praise me up to the point of saying, ‘Those who are dissatisfied have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood,’ I will not respond and will remain silent.

analyzed: bdag gis kyang ci ste len mi 'debs par @164b cang ma smras na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par smad par 'gyur ro //

original: gang chog shes par spyod pa la ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bsngags te /
analyzed: gang chog shes par spyod pa la ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bsngags te /

translated: Contentment is when I have not attained the fruit, but the king says, I have attained the fruit, and I do not desire it. That is called contentment.

original: slob dpon chen po /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po /

original: khyod ni yang dag par dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
analyzed: khyod ni yang dag par dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /

original: sangs rgyas dang tha mi dad do zhes smras na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang tha mi dad do zhes smras na /

analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po des yul mi thams cad dang / btsun mo dang / pho brang gi slas kyi 'khor thams cad du dge slong des dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob bo zhes bsgrags nas /
translated: At that time, the king proclaimed to all the people of the country, to the queen, and to the entire retinue of palace women, This bhikṣu has attained the fruit of the śramaṇa.

original: de skad ces thos pa thams cad dge slong de la shin tu dad pa dang / mchod pa bya ba dang / bkur sti dang rim gro bya ba'i sems bskyed so //
analyzed: de skad ces thos pa thams cad dge slong de la shin tu dad pa dang / mchod pa bya ba dang / bkur sti dang rim gro bya ba'i sems bskyed so //
translated: Having heard this, everyone generated the thought of faith, worship, respect, and service towards that bhikṣu.

original: de ltar dge slong de'ang yang dag par tshangs par spyod cing yongs su dag pa yin pas de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis de la dga' ba thams cad bsod nams chen po thob kyi /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong de'ang yang dag par tshangs par spyod cing yongs su dag pa yin pas de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis de la dga' ba thams cad bsod nams chen po thob kyi /
translated: In this way, the bhikṣu is pure and practices pure celibacy. For this reason and these causes, all those who delight in him will obtain great merit.

original: dge slong de ni phas pham pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong de ni phas pham pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: “The bhikṣu has not committed a transgression that would constitute a pārājika offense.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: pha rol pos dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / bstod pa dang / mchod par bya ba'i sems rangs pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol pos dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / bstod pa dang / mchod par bya ba'i sems rangs pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the other person has given rise to a mind of delight, faith, praise, and worship.

original: de ltar na dge slong de la ni kha na ma tho ba nyams pa med do //🔽de la ni gang zhig de la kha na ma @165a *//
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong de la ni kha na ma tho ba nyams pa med do // de la ni gang zhig de la kha na ma @165a *//
translated: In this way, the bhikṣu has not committed a transgression.

original: tho ba yod ces smran /
analyzed: tho ba yod ces smran /
translated: Who would say that he has committed a transgression?

original: mdo sde de ni bdud kyis bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde de ni bdud kyis bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that this sūtra was taught by Māra.

original: gzhan yang dge slong dag sangs rgyas kyis dgongs te gsungs pa'i mdo sde zab mo las sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong dag sangs rgyas kyis dgongs te gsungs pa'i mdo sde zab mo las sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod de /
translated: “Moreover, bhikṣus, in the profound sūtras that were spoken by the Buddha with a hidden meaning, it is taught that all sentient beings have buddha-nature.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pas tshad med pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa chod cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pas tshad med pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa chod cing /
translated: Because they possess the nature of buddhahood, they will sever the limitless afflictions

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: log sred can ni ma gtogs so zhes smra ba la /
analyzed: log sred can ni ma gtogs so zhes smra ba la /
translated: Except for those with wrong views.”

original: rgyal po'am / blon po chen po zhig gis 'di skad du dge slong khyod mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'am mi rgya /
analyzed: rgyal po'am / blon po chen po zhig gis 'di skad du dge slong khyod mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'am mi rgya /
translated: If a king or a great minister were to ask, ‘Monk, will you fully awaken or not?

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod dam zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod dam zhes 'dri na /
translated: Do you possess the nature of buddhahood or not?’

original: de la 'di skad ces smros shig /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces smros shig /
translated: You should say to them,

original: bdag gi lus la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni nges par yod na sangs rgyas su 'grub bam mi 'grub pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni nges par yod na sangs rgyas su 'grub bam mi 'grub pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: ‘If my body definitely possesses the nature of buddhahood, it is irrelevant whether I will accomplish buddhahood or not.’

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: btsun pa / log sred can gyi las ma byas na /
analyzed: btsun pa / log sred can gyi las ma byas na /
translated: ‘Venerable, if one does not perform the actions of those with wrong views,

original: gdon mi za bar 'grub ste the tshom med do /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'grub ste the tshom med do /
translated: one will definitely accomplish it. There is no doubt.’

original: dge slong gis de la rgyal po chen pos smras pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis de la rgyal po chen pos smras pa bzhin no //
translated: The monk said, ‘It is just as the great king has said.’

original: de skad du nges par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes dge slong des smras kyang phas pham par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du nges par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes dge slong des smras kyang phas pham par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Although the monk says, ‘It is certain that the nature of the Buddha exists,’ he does not commit a pārājika offense.

original: gzhan yang dge slong dag rab tu 'byung ba'i tshe na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong dag rab tu 'byung ba'i tshe na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “Moreover, monks, when going forth, they should think as follows:

analyzed: bdag ni mthar gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o snyam @165b bsams na /
translated: ‘I will certainly attain supreme, perfect enlightenment in the end.’

original: gang zag de bla na med pa'i byang chub ma thob kyang bsod nams tshad med mtha' yas dpag tu med pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: gang zag de bla na med pa'i byang chub ma thob kyang bsod nams tshad med mtha' yas dpag tu med pa 'thob bo //
translated: Even if that person does not attain supreme enlightenment, they will obtain immeasurable, limitless, incalculable merit.🔽If someone were to say to them, ‘You have committed a pārājika offense,’

original: ci ste de la gang zhig gis phas pham pa 'byung ngo zhes smra na; 'o na lta dge slong thams cad phas pham pa ma byung ba med mod /
analyzed: ci ste de la gang zhig gis phas pham pa 'byung ngo zhes smra na; 'o na lta dge slong thams cad phas pham pa ma byung ba med mod /
translated: then, in that case, all monks would not be without having committed a pārājika offense.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nga sngon bskal pa khrag khrig brgyad cu'i bar du ma brtags pa'i dngos po thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: nga sngon bskal pa khrag khrig brgyad cu'i bar du ma brtags pa'i dngos po thams cad spangs te /
translated: For eighty trillion eons in the past, I abandoned all uninvestigated things.

original: 'dod pa nyung ba dang / chog shes pa'i spyod lam dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i chos kyi sde snod la nan tan byas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa nyung ba dang / chog shes pa'i spyod lam dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i chos kyi sde snod la nan tan byas te /
translated: They should practice the Tathāgata’s unsurpassed Dharma-piṭaka with few desires and a contented attitude.

original: bdag gi lus la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nges par yod par shes pas de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba thugs rje chen po dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nges par yod par shes pas de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba thugs rje chen po dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: Because they know that the Buddha-nature definitely exists in their bodies, they will attain supreme, perfect enlightenment and become Buddhas with great compassion.

original: gang 'di skad du smra ba'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba ni sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di skad du smra ba'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba ni sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras and vinayas that teach this are called the Buddha’s teachings.

original: de la gang bstan pa 'di'i rjes su ma 'jug pa ni bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang bstan pa 'di'i rjes su ma 'jug pa ni bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who do not follow these teachings are called followers of Māra.

original: bstan pa 'di'i rjes su 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di'i rjes su 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who follow these teachings are called bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan yang 'di skad du phas pham pa bzhi'ang med la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di skad du phas pham pa bzhi'ang med la /
translated: Moreover, there are no four pārājikas.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma bcu gsum dang / ma nges pa'i chos gnyis dang / spang ba'i ltung ba sum cu dang / ltung ba dgu bcu rtsa gcig dang / so sor bshags pa'i chos bzhi dang / bslab pa mang po dang / bdun shin tu zhi bar byed pa la @166a *//🔽sogs pa'ang med /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma bcu gsum dang / ma nges pa'i chos gnyis dang / spang ba'i ltung ba sum cu dang / ltung ba dgu bcu rtsa gcig dang / so sor bshags pa'i chos bzhi dang / bslab pa mang po dang / bdun shin tu zhi bar byed pa la @166a *// sogs pa'ang med /
translated: There are no thirteen remainders of the monastic code, no two undetermined rules, no thirty downfalls requiring rejection, no ninety-one faults, no four rules requiring confession by a single monk, no many rules, and no seven rules for settling disputes, and so on.

original: sbom po dang / mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa dang / log sred ces bya ba thams cad med do //
analyzed: sbom po dang / mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa dang / log sred ces bya ba thams cad med do //
translated: There are no serious offenses, no five heinous actions, and so on, and no one who is said to have wrong views.

original: gal te dge slong dag de dag la sogs pa nyams pas sems can dmyal bar ltung na mu stegs can thams cad lta mtho ris kyi lhar skye mod /
analyzed: gal te dge slong dag de dag la sogs pa nyams pas sems can dmyal bar ltung na mu stegs can thams cad lta mtho ris kyi lhar skye mod /
translated: If monks who violate such rules fall into hell, then all the non-Buddhists will be born as gods in the heavens.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mu stegs can la sogs pa la tshul khrims zhes bya ba nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can la sogs pa la tshul khrims zhes bya ba nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because non-Buddhists and the like have no violation of what is called morality.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag dag gdul ba'i phyir tshul khrims zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag dag gdul ba'i phyir tshul khrims zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata taught what is called morality in order to discipline people.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa las kyang nga'i dge slong dag gal te mi tshangs par spyod 'dod na chos gos bzhag ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa las kyang nga'i dge slong dag gal te mi tshangs par spyod 'dod na chos gos bzhag ste /
translated: The Buddha said, My monks, if you wish to engage in sexual activity, put aside your Dharma robes,

original: khyim pa'i gos gyon la mi tshangs par spyod cig /
analyzed: khyim pa'i gos gyon la mi tshangs par spyod cig /
translated: put on lay clothes, and engage in sexual activity.

original: gzhan yang 'di snyam du mi tshangs par spyod pa 'di bdag cag 'ba' zhig gi skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di snyam du mi tshangs par spyod pa 'di bdag cag 'ba' zhig gi skyon ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, think, 'This sexual activity is not a fault only for us,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i tshe'ang dge slong dag mi tshangs par spyod de rnam par grol ba'ang yod /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i tshe'ang dge slong dag mi tshangs par spyod de rnam par grol ba'ang yod /
translated: but even when the Tathagata was present, monks engaged in sexual activity and were liberated.

original: tshe 'phos nas mtho ris kyi lhar skye ba'ang ye nas yod de /
analyzed: tshe 'phos nas mtho ris kyi lhar skye ba'ang ye nas yod de /
translated: Even after death, they were born in the higher realms as gods.'

original: bdag 'ba' zhig gis spyod pa ma yin /
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig gis spyod pa ma yin /
translated: It is not only we who engage in this.

original: la la phas pham pa bzhi nyams pa dang / la la tshul khrims lnga nyams pa dang / la la ni ma brtags pa spyod lam ma yin pa'i las thams cad byas kyang yang dag par rnam par grol ba yod de /
analyzed: la la phas pham pa bzhi nyams pa dang / la la tshul khrims lnga nyams pa dang / la la ni ma brtags pa spyod lam ma yin pa'i las thams cad byas kyang yang dag par rnam par grol ba yod de /
translated: Some who have transgressed the four defeats, some who have transgressed the five precepts, and some who have done all sorts of actions that are not the conduct of the uninvestigated, have become perfectly liberated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas nyes pa gcig byas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nyes pa gcig byas na /
translated: The Tathagata said, 'If you commit a single fault,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gnam @166b gyi nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / lor bgrang ba'i lo stong phrag brgyad brgya'i bar du sems can dmyal bar ltung ngo zhes gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gnam @166b gyi nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / lor bgrang ba'i lo stong phrag brgyad brgya'i bar du sems can dmyal bar ltung ngo zhes gsungs mod kyi /
translated: For eight hundred thousand years, the years being of thirty days each, he will fall into the hells.

original: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag dag gdul ba'i phyir gsungs par zad ce'am /

analyzed: phas pham pa dang nyes byas kyi bar du lci yang gi khyad par med de /

analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag gis sangs rgyas kyis bcas par brdzun du smras so //

original: zhes de skad zer na /

analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa ma yin gyi /

analyzed: de skad du smra ba ni bdud kyi mdo sde dang / 'dul ba yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar shes nas ji ltar rus sbal dag yan lag drug sbed pa bzhin du bdag gi lus shin tu bsrung ngo //

analyzed: de la gzhan yang 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag 'di skad du tshul khrims ci nyams kyang kha na ma tho ba'i 'bras bu smin pa med do zhes smra na /
translated: Moreover, the Vinaya masters say that even if one’s morality is impaired, the result of a downfall is not experienced.

analyzed: gang zag de la bsnyen par mi bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs pa /

analyzed: chos gcig tsam las 'das pa gang //

analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma mi mthong bas //

analyzed: sdig pa gang yang  med //

analyzed: de bas na gang zag de la bsnyen par mi bya ste / nga'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ni 'di ltar yongs su dag pa yin na nyes pa sbom po dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang / @167a *//
translated: Therefore, one should not associate with such a person.🔽If my Buddhist teachings are so pure, then what need is there to mention the gross faults, the offenses entailing suspension,

analyzed: phas pham pa dag kha na ma tho ba yin par rtsi ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /

original: de bas na chos de dag shin tu bsrung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na chos de dag shin tu bsrung ngo //

analyzed: so so skye bo dag gal te tshul khrims ma bsrungs na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa'ang tshul khrims bsrungs pa las mthong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mdo sde gsung rab dgu po las shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde med de /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par yang ngas ma gsungs so //

analyzed: mdo sde de las ma gsungs mod kyi /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: 'di mdo sde gsung rab dgu po las ni ma thos na /

analyzed: de mchis par bstan cing gsungs @167b na phas pham par mi 'gyur ram /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: khyod kyis smras ba bzhin te /

analyzed: phas pham par mi 'gyur ro //

original: rigs kyi bu /

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyis ni shes pa'am mthong ba ma yin te /

analyzed: de bas na med ces smras kyang nyes pa med do //

analyzed: 'di ltar spyod yul 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis mkhyen gyi /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: de la shin tu zab mo'i snying po gang zhe na /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: mu stegs can kha cig ni bdag ces bya ba rtag par yang smra /

translated: If one meditates on the essence of the Tathāgata in a way that is not empty, peaceful, and selfless, then that person will continue to revolve in saṃsāra for immeasurable lives and experience suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nga'ang sngon phyin ci log bzhis chos ma yin pa la chos su bzung bas mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa tshad med pa myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: nga'ang sngon phyin ci log bzhis chos ma yin pa la chos su bzung bas mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa tshad med pa myong bar gyur to //
translated: In the past, I also took non-Dharma to be Dharma due to the four errors, and thus experienced immeasurable ripening of non-virtuous karma.

original: da ni lta ba de lta bu'i tshul du lta ba 'gags pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: da ni lta ba de lta bu'i tshul du lta ba 'gags pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Now, by stopping views such as those, I fully awakened to perfect buddhahood.

original: 'di ni lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the noble truth of the path.

original: de la gang zhig 'di skad du dkon mchog gsum mi rtag ces smra zhing lta ba de la sgom na don med par sgom pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang zhig 'di skad du dkon mchog gsum mi rtag ces smra zhing lta ba de la sgom na don med par sgom pa ste /
translated: Those who say that the Three Jewels are impermanent and cultivate that view cultivate a meaningless view,

original: lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa ma yin no //
translated: which is not the noble truth of the path.

original: gang chos de la rtag pa gnas pa'i tshul du sgom na nga'i nye gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang chos de la rtag pa gnas pa'i tshul du sgom na nga'i nye gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who cultivate that Dharma in a way that is stable are called my disciples,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par mthong zhing /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par mthong zhing /
translated: who see the four noble truths correctly

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom pa la nan tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom pa la nan tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and are said to practice the cultivation of the four noble truths.

original: byang chub sems dpa' @174b 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @174b 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Bhagavān:

original: bdag ni gdod 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shin tu nan tan bya ba'i chos 'tshal bar gyur to //
analyzed: bdag ni gdod 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shin tu nan tan bya ba'i chos 'tshal bar gyur to //
translated: “I now understand the Dharma of the four noble truths, which is to be practiced assiduously.”🔽The Bhagavān said to Kāśyapa:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa; rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family!

original: de la phyin ci log bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called four errors are as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: sdug bsngal ma yin pa la sdug bsngal du 'du shes bskyed pa ni phyin ci log ces bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin pa la sdug bsngal du 'du shes bskyed pa ni phyin ci log ces bya'o //
translated: to generate the perception of suffering in the absence of suffering is called an error.

original: sdug bsngal med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of suffering is called the Tathāgata.

original: sdug bsngal bar 'du shes bskyed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar 'du shes bskyed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mi rtag pa'am /
translated: To generate the perception of suffering is to think that the Tathāgata is impermanent,

original: 'gyur zhing 'pho bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing 'pho bar sems pa'o //
translated: changing and transforming.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa la mi rtag ces smra ba ni kha na ma tho ba chen po'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa la mi rtag ces smra ba ni kha na ma tho ba chen po'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: To say that the Tathāgata is impermanent is the suffering of a great offense.

original: gang 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i sku bor te /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i sku bor te /
translated: To say, ‘The Tathāgata has abandoned the body of suffering,

original: shing zad me shi ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das so zhes smra na /
analyzed: shing zad me shi ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das so zhes smra na /
translated: When the wood is exhausted, the fire is extinguished.

original: de ni sdug bsngal med pa la sdug bsngal du 'du shes bskyed pa ste phyin ci log ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal med pa la sdug bsngal du 'du shes bskyed pa ste phyin ci log ces bya'o //
translated: This is called a perversion of perception, because one perceives the absence of suffering as suffering.

original: ci ste ngas de bzhin gshegs pa rtag ces gsungs na /
analyzed: ci ste ngas de bzhin gshegs pa rtag ces gsungs na /
translated: If I were to say that the Tathāgata is permanent,

original: de ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
analyzed: de ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
translated: that would be a view of self.

original: bdag tu lta ba tshad med pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba tshad med pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur te /
translated: A view of self is an immeasurable offense.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtag ces gsung pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtag ces gsung pa'i rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to say that the Tathāgata is impermanent.

original: gang de skad du smra na bdag ces bya ba bde ba myong ngo //
analyzed: gang de skad du smra na bdag ces bya ba bde ba myong ngo //
translated: If one were to say such a thing, it would be to say that the self experiences pleasure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag ces smra na sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag ces smra na sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: If one were to say that the Tathāgata is impermanent, that would be suffering.

original: ci ste sdug bsngal ba yin na ci'i phyir bde bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽sdug bsngal la bde  bar 'du shes pas phyin ci log go /
analyzed: ci ste sdug bsngal ba yin na ci'i phyir bde bar 'gyur zhe na / sdug bsngal la bde  bar 'du shes pas phyin ci log go /
translated: If it is suffering, why would it be pleasure?🔽Because one perceives suffering as pleasure, that is a perversion.

original: bde ba la sdug bsngal bar 'du shes na'ang phyin ci @175a *//
analyzed: bde ba la sdug bsngal bar 'du shes na'ang phyin ci @175a *//
translated: If one perceives pleasure as suffering, that is also a perversion.

original: log go / bde ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: log go / bde ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Pleasure is the Tathāgata.

original: sdug bsngal ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag ces smra ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag ces smra ba'o //
translated: To say that the Tathāgata is suffering is to say that the Tathāgata is impermanent.

original: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag ces smra na /
analyzed: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag ces smra na /
translated: If one says that the Tathāgata is impermanent,

original: de ni bde ba la sdug bsngal du 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bde ba la sdug bsngal du 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called perceiving happiness as suffering.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag ces bya ba ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag ces bya ba ni bde ba'o //
translated: To say that the Tathāgata is permanent is to say that he is happy.

original: ci ste ngas gsungs pa ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa yin na ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'da'/
analyzed: ci ste ngas gsungs pa ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa yin na ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'da'/
translated: If, as I have taught, the Tathāgata is permanent, why would he pass into nirvāṇa?

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa sdug bsngal ba ma yin na ci'i phyir sku bor te mya ngan las 'da' bar zhugs /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa sdug bsngal ba ma yin na ci'i phyir sku bor te mya ngan las 'da' bar zhugs /
translated: If the Tathāgata is not suffering, why would he abandon his body and enter nirvāṇa?

original: zhes de ltar bde ba la sdug bsngal bar 'du shes na phyin ci log gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes de ltar bde ba la sdug bsngal bar 'du shes na phyin ci log gcig ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, if one perceives happiness as suffering, that is called a perversion.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa dang / rtag pa la mi rtag par 'du shes pa'ang phyin ci log ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa dang / rtag pa la mi rtag par 'du shes pa'ang phyin ci log ces bya'o //
translated: To perceive the impermanent as permanent and the permanent as impermanent is also called a perversion.

original: mi rtag pa ni stong pa nyid mi sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni stong pa nyid mi sgom pa'o //
translated: The impermanent is not cultivating emptiness.

original: ston pa nyid ma bsgoms pas tshe thung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston pa nyid ma bsgoms pas tshe thung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one does not cultivate the Teacher, one’s life will be short.

original: de la gang stong pa nyid kyis zhi ba ma bsgoms kyang tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang stong pa nyid kyis zhi ba ma bsgoms kyang tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone says that life can be prolonged without cultivating the peace of emptiness,

original: zhes smra na phyin ci log ces bya ste /
analyzed: zhes smra na phyin ci log ces bya ste /
translated: that is called a perversion.

original: phyin ci log gnyis so //🔽bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes /
analyzed: phyin ci log gnyis so // bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes /
translated: There are two perversions.🔽The first is perceiving a self in nonself.

original: bdag la bdag med par 'du shes pa'ang phyin ci log go /
analyzed: bdag la bdag med par 'du shes pa'ang phyin ci log go /
translated: The second is perceiving nonself in a self.

original: 'jig rten pa'ang bdag yod par smra /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'ang bdag yod par smra /
translated: The world says that a self exists.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la'ang bdag yod par smra ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la'ang bdag yod par smra ste /
translated: The Buddha’s teachings also say that a self exists.

original: 'jig rten pa dag bdag yod par smra mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag bdag yod par smra mod kyi /
translated: Although the world says that a self exists,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pas de ni bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pas de ni bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa ste /
translated: since the Buddha-nature does not exist, that is perceiving a self in nonself.

original: phyin ci log ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ces bya'o //
translated: That is called a perversion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi @175b chos kyi bdag yod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi @175b chos kyi bdag yod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The self that exists in the Buddha’s teachings is the Buddha-nature.

original: 'jig rten pa dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la bdag med ces smra bas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la bdag med ces smra bas /
translated: Since the world says that the Buddha’s teachings are nonself,

original: de bas na bdag la bdag med par 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag la bdag med par 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is perceiving a self as nonself.

original: gal te sangs rgyas kyi chos la nges par bdag med ces smra na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas kyi chos la nges par bdag med ces smra na /
translated: If you say that the Buddha’s Dharma is definitely without self,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas nye gnas rnams la bdag med par sgoms shig ces bka' stsal pa'ang phyin ci log ces bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nye gnas rnams la bdag med par sgoms shig ces bka' stsal pa'ang phyin ci log ces bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the Tathāgata’s teaching to his disciples to meditate on selflessness would be a mistake.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log gsum mo //
translated: This is the third mistake.

original: gtsang ba la mi gtsang bar 'du shes /
analyzed: gtsang ba la mi gtsang bar 'du shes /
translated: To perceive the pure as impure

original: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'du shes pa'ang phyin ci log go //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'du shes pa'ang phyin ci log go //
translated: and the impure as pure is a mistake.

original: gtsang ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa /
analyzed: gtsang ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa /
translated: The pure is the Tathāgata, who is permanent,

original: gnas pa zhal zas dang 'dres pa'i sku ma yin /
analyzed: gnas pa zhal zas dang 'dres pa'i sku ma yin /
translated: not a body mixed with food,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sku ma yin //🔽sha dang khrag gi sku ma yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sku ma yin // sha dang khrag gi sku ma yin //
translated: not a body of afflictions,🔽not a body of flesh and blood,

original: rtsa dang chu ba dang rus pas rnam par glags pa'i sku ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsa dang chu ba dang rus pas rnam par glags pa'i sku ma yin te /
translated: not a body composed of channels, sinews, and bones.

original: de la gang 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtag pa /🔽zhal zas dang 'dres pa'i sku /
analyzed: de la gang 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtag pa / zhal zas dang 'dres pa'i sku /
translated: Those who say that the Tathāgata is impermanent,🔽a body mixed with food,🔽a body composed of channels, sinews, and bones,

original: rtsa ba dang / chu ba dang rus pa'i bar du rnam par glags pa'i sku yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / chu ba dang rus pa'i bar du rnam par glags pa'i sku yin te /
translated: up to

original: chos dang / dge 'dun dang / rnam par grol ba'ang 'gog cing zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang / dge 'dun dang / rnam par grol ba'ang 'gog cing zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Dharma, the Saṅgha, and liberation will be stopped and exhausted.

original: zhes smra na phyin ci log ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes smra na phyin ci log ces bya'o //
translated: If one says this, it is called a perversion.

original: mi gtsang ba la gtang bar 'du shes pa ni gang 'di skad du nga'i lus 'di la gcig tsam yang mi gtsang ba med de /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la gtang bar 'du shes pa ni gang 'di skad du nga'i lus 'di la gcig tsam yang mi gtsang ba med de /
translated: The perception of giving to the impure refers to those who say, “In my body there is not even one thing that is impure.

original: mi gtsang ba med pas na gdon mi za bar yongs su dag pa'i gnas su phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba med pas na gdon mi za bar yongs su dag pa'i gnas su phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: Since there is nothing impure, I will certainly reach the state of complete purity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mi gtsang ba sgom pa la nan tan gyis shig ces gsungs pa'ang rdzun no zhes smra na @176a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mi gtsang ba sgom pa la nan tan gyis shig ces gsungs pa'ang rdzun no zhes smra na @176a *//
translated: The Tathāgata’s teaching to diligently cultivate the contemplation of the impure is false.”

original: phyin ci log ces bya ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ces bya ste /
translated: If one says this, it is called a perversion.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the four perversions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa again addressed the Buddha, saying:

original: bdag cag ni sngon ngan par lta ba las gdod yang dag par lta bar gyur to //
analyzed: bdag cag ni sngon ngan par lta ba las gdod yang dag par lta bar gyur to //
translated: “We have now turned from our former wrong views to the correct view.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: World-Honored One,

original: srid pa nyi shu lnga po la bdag ces bgyi ba mchis sam /
analyzed: srid pa nyi shu lnga po la bdag ces bgyi ba mchis sam /
translated: are there any of the twenty-five existences that can be called ‘self’?

original: ma mchis / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: ma mchis / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Buddha said, “Good son,

original: bdag ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i don to //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i don to //
translated: self means the meaning of the Tathagata-garbha.

original: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa ni bdag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa ni bdag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The existence of the Buddha-nature in all sentient beings is the meaning of self.

original: de ltar bdag ces bya ba'i don ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas tshad med pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas rnam par bsgribs te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag ces bya ba'i don ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas tshad med pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas rnam par bsgribs te /
translated: Thus the meaning of self has been obscured from beginningless time by immeasurable defilements.

original: de bas na sems can dag mthong bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: de bas na sems can dag mthong bar ma gyur to //
translated: Therefore sentient beings do not see it.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Good son,

original: dper na / bud med dbul mo zhig khang pa'i nang na gser gyi /
analyzed: dper na / bud med dbul mo zhig khang pa'i nang na gser gyi /
translated: it is like a poor woman who has gold in her house.

original: ter yod kyang thams cad kyis yod par mi shes pa las phyis skyes bu shin tu thabs la mkhas pa gcig gis bud med dbul mo la 'di skad du /
analyzed: ter yod kyang thams cad kyis yod par mi shes pa las phyis skyes bu shin tu thabs la mkhas pa gcig gis bud med dbul mo la 'di skad du /
translated: Although it is there, no one knows about it. Later a skillful man discovers this and says to the poor woman,

original: bu mo khyod kho bo'i phyag dar bar gla za nus sam /
analyzed: bu mo khyod kho bo'i phyag dar bar gla za nus sam /
translated: ‘Woman, can you work for me?🔽’

original: bud med des smras pa /
analyzed: bud med des smras pa /
translated: The woman replies,

original: kho mos mi nus so //
analyzed: kho mos mi nus so //
translated: ‘I cannot.

original: ci ste khyod kyis kho mo'i bus gser gyi gter zhig sbas pa bstan nus na khyod kyi las bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste khyod kyis kho mo'i bus gser gyi gter zhig sbas pa bstan nus na khyod kyi las bya'o //
translated: “If you can show me where your son has hidden a treasure, then I will do your bidding.”

original: skyes bu des smras pa /
analyzed: skyes bu des smras pa /
translated: The man said,

original: kho bo ni shin tu thabs mkhas pas khyod kyi bus sbas pa'i gser gyi gter kho bos shes kyi bstan to //
analyzed: kho bo ni shin tu thabs mkhas pas khyod kyi bus sbas pa'i gser gyi gter kho bos shes kyi bstan to //
translated: “I am very skilled. I know where your son has hidden a treasure of gold. I will show it to you.”🔽The woman said,

original: bud med des smras @176b pa; kho mo'i khyim gang gi mi tshe phra thams cad kyis kyang mi shes na cig khyod kyis shes sam /
analyzed: bud med des smras @176b pa; kho mo'i khyim gang gi mi tshe phra thams cad kyis kyang mi shes na cig khyod kyis shes sam /
translated: “Even all the people in my house do not know. How could you know?”

original: skyes bu des smras pa /
analyzed: skyes bu des smras pa /
translated: The man said,

original: kho bos ni the tshom med par shes so //
analyzed: kho bos ni the tshom med par shes so //
translated: “I know without a doubt.”

original: bud med des smras pa /
analyzed: bud med des smras pa /
translated: The woman said,

original: kho mos mthong bar 'dod kyi ston cig /
analyzed: kho mos mthong bar 'dod kyi ston cig /
translated: “I want to see it. Show it to me.”

original: de nas skyes bu des kho mo'i khang par zhugs nas gser gyi gter brus te bud med de la bstan to //
analyzed: de nas skyes bu des kho mo'i khang par zhugs nas gser gyi gter brus te bud med de la bstan to //
translated: Then the man entered her house, dug up the treasure of gold, and showed it to the woman.

original: bud med des gter mthong nas shin tu dga' mgu ste ngo mtshar rmad kyi 'du shes skyes nas /
analyzed: bud med des gter mthong nas shin tu dga' mgu ste ngo mtshar rmad kyi 'du shes skyes nas /
translated: When the woman saw the treasure, she was very happy and gave rise to the notion of marvel and wonder.

original: skyes bu de la bsti stang du byed do //
analyzed: skyes bu de la bsti stang du byed do //
translated: She honored the man.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family!

original: sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Buddha-nature of all sentient beings is also like this.

original: sems can thams cad kyis mi mthong ba'ang ji ltar bud med dbul mos rin po che'i gter mi mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis mi mthong ba'ang ji ltar bud med dbul mos rin po che'i gter mi mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the poor woman did not see the precious treasure, so it is that all sentient beings do not see the Buddha-nature.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: ngas skye bo thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa kun nas nyon mongs pas bsgribs te /
analyzed: ngas skye bo thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa kun nas nyon mongs pas bsgribs te /
translated: I have taught that all people have Buddha-nature, but it is obscured by the defilements,

original: mi mthong ba bstan pa'ang ji ltar bud med dbul mos gser gyi gter mi mthong ba bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mthong ba bstan pa'ang ji ltar bud med dbul mos gser gyi gter mi mthong ba bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: and so they do not see it, just as the poor woman did not see the treasure of gold.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang sems can thams cad la mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i rin po che'i gter bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang sems can thams cad la mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i rin po che'i gter bstan pa ni /
translated: the Tathagata has revealed to all sentient beings the precious treasure of manifest Buddhahood,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: which is

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: the Buddha-nature.

original: so so skye bo dag kyang de lta bu'i dngos po rnams mthong nas rab tu dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
analyzed: so so skye bo dag kyang de lta bu'i dngos po rnams mthong nas rab tu dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
translated: Ordinary people, seeing such things, give rise to a mind of great joy.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed cing phyogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed cing phyogs so //
translated: and to serve the Tathagata, and to go to the ten directions.

original: thabs mkhas pa'i skyes bu zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i skyes bu zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The skillful person is a metaphor for the Tathagata.

original: bud med dbul mo zhes bya ba ni @177a *//
analyzed: bud med dbul mo zhes bya ba ni @177a *//
translated: The poor woman is a metaphor for

original: so so skye bo tshad med pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: so so skye bo tshad med pa'i dpe'o //
translated: the immeasurable ordinary beings.

original: gser gyi gter zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gser gyi gter zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The golden treasure is a metaphor for

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi dpe'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi dpe'o //
translated: the Buddha-nature.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: It is also like this.

original: dper na; bud med bu chung ngu kha myag gso ba zhig gal te bu de nad kyis btab na bud med de shin tu mya ngan gyis gdungs te sman pa 'tshol lo //
analyzed: dper na; bud med bu chung ngu kha myag gso ba zhig gal te bu de nad kyis btab na bud med de shin tu mya ngan gyis gdungs te sman pa 'tshol lo //
translated: For example, a woman who is nursing a small child, if that child becomes ill, that woman will be greatly afflicted with grief and will seek a doctor.

original: de la sman pas sman mar dang / 'o ma dang / sha kha ra dang gsum du sbyar te /
analyzed: de la sman pas sman mar dang / 'o ma dang / sha kha ra dang gsum du sbyar te /
translated: The doctor will prescribe a medicine of ghee, milk, and sugar,

original: bu la blud nas bud med de la 'di skad ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: bu la blud nas bud med de la 'di skad ces bsgo'o //
translated: and give it to the child. He will tell the woman,

original: bu 'di sman btang gi /
analyzed: bu 'di sman btang gi /
translated: This child has been given medicine.

original: re zhig sman ma zhu ba'i bar du nu zho blud du mi rung ngo zhes bsgo'o //
analyzed: re zhig sman ma zhu ba'i bar du nu zho blud du mi rung ngo zhes bsgo'o //
translated: For the time being, it is not suitable to give him breast milk until the medicine has been digested.

original: de nas bud med des nu zho mi bsnun pa'i phyir nu ma la mkhris pas byugs nas bu la kho mo'i nu ma dug gis bskus te nur mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de nas bud med des nu zho mi bsnun pa'i phyir nu ma la mkhris pas byugs nas bu la kho mo'i nu ma dug gis bskus te nur mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Then the woman, in order to stop the child from sucking, smeared her breast with a bitter substance and said to him, “My breast is poisoned. You cannot suck it.”

original: bu de skom gyis gdungs te /
analyzed: bu de skom gyis gdungs te /
translated: The child, tormented by thirst,

original: nu ma nu 'dod kyang kha ba'i ro tshor ma thag tu nur mi btub bo //
analyzed: nu ma nu 'dod kyang kha ba'i ro tshor ma thag tu nur mi btub bo //
translated: wanted to suck the breast, but as soon as he tasted the bitter substance, he drew back.

original: sman zhu bas bud med kyis nu ma dag par bkrus te /
analyzed: sman zhu bas bud med kyis nu ma dag par bkrus te /
translated: The physician, having purified the woman’s breast,

original: 'di skad du bu tshur shog /
analyzed: 'di skad du bu tshur shog /
translated: said to her, “Come, child,

original: da nu ma nur gzhug go zhes smras na /
analyzed: da nu ma nur gzhug go zhes smras na /
translated: now you can suck my breast.”

original: khye'u de skom gyis gdungs kyang sngar kha ba'i ro myong bas bos kyang 'ong du mi btub bo //
analyzed: khye'u de skom gyis gdungs kyang sngar kha ba'i ro myong bas bos kyang 'ong du mi btub bo //
translated: Although the child was tormented by thirst, he did not dare to approach, because of the bitter taste he had previously experienced.

original: de la'ang mas 'di skad du bsgo'o //
analyzed: de la'ang mas 'di skad du bsgo'o //
translated: His mother said to him,

original: khyod da ci sngar sman 'thungs te sman ma zhu ba'i bar du nu ma blud du mi rung bas kho mos dug gis bskus pa yin kyi /
analyzed: khyod da ci sngar sman 'thungs te sman ma zhu ba'i bar du nu ma blud du mi rung bas kho mos dug gis bskus pa yin kyi /
translated: “The medicine you took earlier has not yet been digested. Until it is digested, you cannot suck my breast. I smeared it with a bitter substance to keep you away.

original: da khyod kyi sman yang zhu la /
analyzed: da khyod kyi sman yang zhu la /
translated: Now your medicine has been digested.

original: kha ba'ang bkrus kyi /
analyzed: kha ba'ang bkrus kyi /
translated: The bitter substance has been washed off.

original: da ni kha ba'i ro med do zhes smras na /
analyzed: da ni kha ba'i ro med do zhes smras na /
translated: There is no longer any bitter taste.”

original: gdod bags kyis nye ste 'thung @177b du btub bo //
analyzed: gdod bags kyis nye ste 'thung @177b du btub bo //
translated: and then gradually they can drink it.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de bzhin du sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir sems can thams cad bdag med pa'i chos la nan tan byed pa ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de bzhin du sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir sems can thams cad bdag med pa'i chos la nan tan byed pa ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata is also like this. In order to liberate all sentient beings, he teaches all sentient beings to practice the Dharma of selflessness.

original: de la nan tan byas pas bdag cag bya ba'i sems med de /
analyzed: de la nan tan byas pas bdag cag bya ba'i sems med de /
translated: By practicing it, we have no thought of action

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: and we attain complete nirvāṇa.

original: de la'ang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i ngan par lta ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la'ang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i ngan par lta ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to eliminate the bad views of the Lokāyatas,

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i chos las 'das pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i chos las 'das pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach what transcends the Dharma of the Lokāyatas,

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag bdag tu lta ba yang dag pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag bdag tu lta ba yang dag pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and also in order to teach that the Lokāyatas’ view of self is not correct,

original: bdag med pa'i chos bsgoms pas yongs su dag pa'i lus su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i chos bsgoms pas yongs su dag pa'i lus su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to purify the body through the cultivation of the Dharma of selflessness,

original: ji ltar bud med des bu'i phyir mkhris pas nu ma bskus pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bud med des bu'i phyir mkhris pas nu ma bskus pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: just as that woman anointed her breast with bile for the sake of her child, the Tathāgata is also like that.

original: stong pa nyid bsgoms pa'i phyir chos thams cad la bdag med ces gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgoms pa'i phyir chos thams cad la bdag med ces gsungs so //
translated: Because of the cultivation of emptiness, it is said that all phenomena are without self.

original: ji ltar bud med des nu ma phyir bkrus nas bu bos te nu zho blud do zhes bya ba bzhin du ngas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bud med des nu ma phyir bkrus nas bu bos te nu zho blud do zhes bya ba bzhin du ngas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as that woman, having washed her breast, called out to her child and gave her breast for it to drink, so it is with my teaching of the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: dge slong khyod kyang ma skrag par ji ltar bu de la mas bos te nu zho bags kyis 'thung ba bzhin du dge slong khyed kyang bye brag phyed par gyis shig /
analyzed: dge slong khyod kyang ma skrag par ji ltar bu de la mas bos te nu zho bags kyis 'thung ba bzhin du dge slong khyed kyang bye brag phyed par gyis shig /
translated: Bhikṣus, you should not be afraid, just as that child, having been called out to by its mother, gradually drank the breast milk. Bhikṣus, you should discriminate in this way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni med par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni med par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The essence of the Tathāgata is not to be eliminated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: yang dag par bdag ces bgyi ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: yang dag par bdag ces bgyi ba ma mchis so //
translated: there is no so-called self.

original: @178a *// de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: @178a *// de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bus pa chung ngu ni thog ma btsas pa na ci'ang bye brag mi phyed de mi 'tshal to //
analyzed: bus pa chung ngu ni thog ma btsas pa na ci'ang bye brag mi phyed de mi 'tshal to //
translated: A small child, when first born, does not discriminate anything at all, and does not eat.

original: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba mchis pa lags na btsas ma thag tu thams cad bye brag 'byed cing 'tshal ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba mchis pa lags na btsas ma thag tu thams cad bye brag 'byed cing 'tshal ba'i rigs so //
translated: If there is a self, then as soon as one is born, one should be able to distinguish and understand everything.

original: de bas na nges par bdag ces bgyi ba ma mchis par mngon no //
analyzed: de bas na nges par bdag ces bgyi ba ma mchis par mngon no //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that there is definitely no self.

original: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba nges par mchis pa zhig lags na skye ba gcig blangs nas mthar ma mchis par 'gyur ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba nges par mchis pa zhig lags na skye ba gcig blangs nas mthar ma mchis par 'gyur ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: If there were definitely a self, then after taking one birth, it should be endless.🔽If all have the buddha-nature and are permanent, then destruction is not reasonable.

original: ci ste thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis te rtag pa zhig lags na 'jig pa'ang mi rigs so; ;gal te 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma lags na /
analyzed: ci ste thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis te rtag pa zhig lags na 'jig pa'ang mi rigs so; ;gal te 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma lags na /
translated: If it is not the characteristic of destruction,

original: ci'i slad du rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / rigs ngan dang / gdol pa dang / byol song la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad de /
analyzed: ci'i slad du rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / rigs ngan dang / gdol pa dang / byol song la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad de /
translated: why are there different kinds, such as the kṣatriyas, the brahmans, the low-caste people, the outcasts, and the animals, and so on?

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa rnam pa sna tshogs mi mthun zhing rgyu tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa rnam pa sna tshogs mi mthun zhing rgyu tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: The various ripening of karma are not the same, and the causes are different.

original: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba nges par mchis na sems can thams cad la bzang ngan ma mchis pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba nges par mchis na sems can thams cad la bzang ngan ma mchis pa'i rigs te /
translated: If there is a so-called self, then it would be unreasonable for there to be good and bad among all sentient beings.

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin zhes bgyi ba ni rtag pa'i chos ma lags par mngon no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin zhes bgyi ba ni rtag pa'i chos ma lags par mngon no //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that what is called the buddha-nature is not a permanent phenomenon.

original: ci ste sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nges par rtag pa zhig lags na /
analyzed: ci ste sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nges par rtag pa zhig lags na /
translated: If the buddha-nature is definitely permanent,

original: ci'i slad du srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / tshig thun tshags dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
analyzed: ci'i slad du srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / tshig thun tshags dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
translated: why did you teach and speak about killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, desire, anger,

original: @178b ngan par lta ba la sogs pa bstan cing gsungs /
analyzed: @178b ngan par lta ba la sogs pa bstan cing gsungs /
translated: evil views, and so forth?

original: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba'i rang bzhin rtag pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba'i rang bzhin rtag pa lags na /
translated: If the nature of the so-called self is permanent,

original: ci'i slad du chang 'thungs pas myos shing dran pa nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i slad du chang 'thungs pas myos shing dran pa nyams par 'gyur /
translated: why does drinking alcohol cause one to become intoxicated and lose one’s memory?

original: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba'i rang bzhin rtag pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba'i rang bzhin rtag pa lags na /
translated: If the nature of the so-called self is permanent,

original: long bas kyang gzugs mthong la /
analyzed: long bas kyang gzugs mthong la /
translated: The blind will see forms.

original: 'on pas kyang sgra thos /
analyzed: 'on pas kyang sgra thos /
translated: The deaf will hear sounds.

original: lkugs pas kyang smra nus /
analyzed: lkugs pas kyang smra nus /
translated: The mute will be able to speak.

original: zha bos kyang 'gro nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zha bos kyang 'gro nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: The crippled will be able to walk.

original: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba'i rang bzhin rtag na chu dang / me dang / g-yang sa dang / dug dang / mtshon dang / gcan gzan ma rungs pa las kyang 'byol ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba'i rang bzhin rtag na chu dang / me dang / g-yang sa dang / dug dang / mtshon dang / gcan gzan ma rungs pa las kyang 'byol ba mi rigs so //
translated: If the so-called self is permanent by nature, it would be illogical to avoid water, fire, cliffs, poison, weapons, and vicious animals.

original: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba rtag na sngon ci shes pa phyis brjed pa'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba rtag na sngon ci shes pa phyis brjed pa'i mi rigs so //
translated: If the so-called self is permanent, it would be illogical to forget something previously known.

original: ci ste phyis mi brjed na ci'i slad du bdag gis mi 'di sngon ma mthong ngo zhes bgyi ba la sogs pa smra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste phyis mi brjed na ci'i slad du bdag gis mi 'di sngon ma mthong ngo zhes bgyi ba la sogs pa smra bar 'gyur /
translated: If it does not forget later on, why would one say, “I have never seen this person before”?

original: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba rtag na gzhon nu lang tsho ba dang / rgas te rgud pa la sogs pa dang / sngon ci byas pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang mi brjed de dran pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bgyi ba rtag na gzhon nu lang tsho ba dang / rgas te rgud pa la sogs pa dang / sngon ci byas pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang mi brjed de dran pa'i rigs so //
translated: If the so-called self is permanent, it would be logical that one would not forget anything done in the past, such as being a youth, a young adult, or an old person.

original: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba rtag na ci la gnas /
analyzed: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba rtag na ci la gnas /
translated: If the so-called self is permanent, on what does it depend?

original: mchil ma dang / snabs la gnas sam /
analyzed: mchil ma dang / snabs la gnas sam /
translated: Is it in saliva or mucus?

original: kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po la sogs pa la gnas /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po la sogs pa la gnas /
translated: Is it in blue, yellow, red, or other colors?

original: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba rtag pa zhig lags na til mar gyi lus bskus pa bzhin du thams cad du khyab pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: ci ste bdag ces bgyi ba rtag pa zhig lags na til mar gyi lus bskus pa bzhin du thams cad du khyab pa'i rigs te /
translated: If the so-called self is permanent, then it should be pervasive, like oil permeating sesame seeds.

original: gal te lus bcad pa'i tshe bdag kyang chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gal te lus bcad pa'i tshe bdag kyang chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: If the body is cut, then the self should be cut as well.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' @179a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' @179a *//
translated: The Buddha told Kāśyapa:

original: stsal pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: stsal pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / rgyal po la gyad gcig yod pa'i dpral ba na rdo rje'i nor bu gcig yod pa gyad gzhan dang stobs bkye ba las /
analyzed: dper na / rgyal po la gyad gcig yod pa'i dpral ba na rdo rje'i nor bu gcig yod pa gyad gzhan dang stobs bkye ba las /
translated: For example, a king had a wrestler whose forehead had a vajra gem. The wrestler challenged another wrestler to a contest of strength.

original: gyad pha rol pos mgos reg ste /
analyzed: gyad pha rol pos mgos reg ste /
translated: The other wrestler touched his head to the forehead of the first wrestler.

original: dpral ba'i nor bu sha'i nang du nub kyang nor bu gar song ba mi shes so //
analyzed: dpral ba'i nor bu sha'i nang du nub kyang nor bu gar song ba mi shes so //
translated: The gem on the forehead sank into the flesh, but no one knew where the gem had gone.

original: rma byung ba'i phyir sman pa bos nas sman pa shin tu mkhas pas ni nor bu sha'i nang du song ba'i phyir rma byung ba de la sman mi byed de /
analyzed: rma byung ba'i phyir sman pa bos nas sman pa shin tu mkhas pas ni nor bu sha'i nang du song ba'i phyir rma byung ba de la sman mi byed de /
translated: Because of the wound, he summoned a physician. The very skilled physician, because the jewel had entered into the flesh, did not treat the wound.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: He said this:

original: kye stobs po che khyod kyi dpral ba'i nor bu ga re zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kye stobs po che khyod kyi dpral ba'i nor bu ga re zhes zer ro //
translated: “Oh strong man, where is the jewel on your forehead?”

original: gyad de dngangs nas sman pa la 'di skad du bdag gi dpral ba'i nor bu gar yang ma song ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: gyad de dngangs nas sman pa la 'di skad du bdag gi dpral ba'i nor bu gar yang ma song ba'i rigs te /
translated: The wrestler was frightened and said to the physician, “It is not right that the jewel on my forehead has gone anywhere.

original: da med na 'di sgyu ma ma yin nam snyam sems te /
analyzed: da med na 'di sgyu ma ma yin nam snyam sems te /
translated: If it is not here now, I think it is an illusion.”

original: shin tu mya ngan byed do //
analyzed: shin tu mya ngan byed do //
translated: He was very sad.

original: de nas sman pa des gyad de spro ba bskyed nas khyod de ltar mya ngan ma byed cig /
analyzed: de nas sman pa des gyad de spro ba bskyed nas khyod de ltar mya ngan ma byed cig /
translated: Then the physician encouraged the wrestler, “You should not be so sad.

original: khyod stobs bkye ba na nor bu sha'i nang du nub ste gzugs brnyan tsam phyi rol tu snang ngo //
analyzed: khyod stobs bkye ba na nor bu sha'i nang du nub ste gzugs brnyan tsam phyi rol tu snang ngo //
translated: When you exerted your strength, the jewel sank into your flesh, and only its reflection appeared on the surface.

original: khyod stobs bkye ba na zhe sdang bskyed de /
analyzed: khyod stobs bkye ba na zhe sdang bskyed de /
translated: When you exerted your strength, you generated anger.

original: nor bu'i mthus sha'i nang du nub kyang ma tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: nor bu'i mthus sha'i nang du nub kyang ma tshor ba yin no //
translated: Because of the power of the jewel, it sank into your flesh without your feeling it.”

original: de skad du smras kyang yid ma ches nas /
analyzed: de skad du smras kyang yid ma ches nas /
translated: Even though he said this, the strong man still did not believe him.

original: 'di skad du sman pa khyod rdzun ma zer cig /
analyzed: 'di skad du sman pa khyod rdzun ma zer cig /
translated: He said, “You doctor, do not speak falsely!

original: ci ste sha'i nang du nub na rnag khrag shin tu btsog pa yin pas phyir 'byung ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste sha'i nang du nub na rnag khrag shin tu btsog pa yin pas phyir 'byung ba'i rigs so //
translated: If it were inside the flesh, then because of the foul pus and blood, it would have to come out.

original: ci ste chu ba'i nang du song ba ni khyod kyis kyang mthong ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste chu ba'i nang du song ba ni khyod kyis kyang mthong ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: If it were inside the bone, then you would not be able to see it.

original: de nas sman pas me long ltar bcug nas me long gi nang du nor bu'ang gsal bar snang bar @179b gyur to //
analyzed: de nas sman pas me long ltar bcug nas me long gi nang du nor bu'ang gsal bar snang bar @179b gyur to //
translated: ” Then the doctor took a mirror and held it up, and the jewel clearly appeared in the mirror.

original: gyad des de ltar gyur pa mthong nas ngo mtshar rmad kyi 'du shes skyes so //
analyzed: gyad des de ltar gyur pa mthong nas ngo mtshar rmad kyi 'du shes skyes so //
translated: When the strong man saw this, he was filled with wonder.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of good family!

original: sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: All sentient beings are like this.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur ma byas pas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod kyang mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur ma byas pas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod kyang mthong bar mi nus so //

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis bsgribs te zil gyis non pas sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin dang / gdol pa dang / rigs ngan dang / rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs su skye zhing lhung bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis bsgribs te zil gyis non pas sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin dang / gdol pa dang / rigs ngan dang / rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs su skye zhing lhung bar gyur to //
translated: Because of being obscured and overwhelmed by desire, anger, and ignorance, they are born in the various destinies of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, asuras, untouchables, outcastes, kṣatriyas, brahmins, and so on.

original: sems la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi las bskyed pas mi'i lus thob kyang 'on pa dang / long ba dang / lkugs pa dang / zha bo la sogs par gyur te /
analyzed: sems la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi las bskyed pas mi'i lus thob kyang 'on pa dang / long ba dang / lkugs pa dang / zha bo la sogs par gyur te /
translated: Because of creating various kinds of karma in their minds, even when they obtain a human body, they are born deaf, blind, mute, crippled, and so on.

original: srid pa nyi shu lnga por rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: srid pa nyi shu lnga por rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu myong bar gyur to //
translated: They experience the ripened results in the twenty-five states of existence.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sems bsgribs pas na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sems bsgribs pas na /
translated: Because their minds are obscured by desire, anger, and ignorance,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi shes pas ni ji ltar gyad des nor bu rin po che sha'i nang du nub pa mi shes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi shes pas ni ji ltar gyad des nor bu rin po che sha'i nang du nub pa mi shes te /
translated: they do not know buddha-nature. It is like the wrestler who does not know that the precious jewel has disappeared into his flesh.

original: stor snyam sems pa ltar so so skye bo'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: stor snyam sems pa ltar so so skye bo'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Ordinary people are like this, too.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed pa mi shes /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed pa mi shes /
translated: They do not know how to serve a spiritual teacher.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po shin tu gsang ba mi shes pas bdag med pa la sgom zhing nan tan byed do // dper na / 'phags pa ma yin pa dag ni bdag med pa smra'ang bdag ces bya ba'i yang dag pa'i mtshan @180a *//
translated: They do not know the secret of the essence of the Tathagata, and so they meditate on selflessness and make an effort at it.

original: nyid mi shes so //
analyzed: nyid mi shes so //

original: nga'i nye gnas dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nga'i nye gnas dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: My disciples are like this, too.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed pa'ang mi shes pas bdag med pa sgom pa'ang mi shes te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed pa'ang mi shes pas bdag med pa sgom pa'ang mi shes te /
translated: They do not know how to serve a spiritual teacher, and so they do not know how to meditate on selflessness.

original: bdag med pa'i gnas kyang mi shes so //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i gnas kyang mi shes so //
translated: They do not know the basis of selflessness.

original: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mi shes na bdag gi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mi shes na bdag gi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa lta ci smos /
