original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par gsungs pa'ang ji ltar sman pa mkhas pas gyad kyi rdo rje'i nor bu bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par gsungs pa'ang ji ltar sman pa mkhas pas gyad kyi rdo rje'i nor bu bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata’s statement that all sentient beings have buddha-nature is like the skilled physician’s demonstration of the vajra-jewel of the strongman.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed kyis bsgribs shing zil gyis non pas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi shes so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed kyis bsgribs shing zil gyis non pas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi shes so //
translated: Ordinary beings do not know buddha-nature because it is obscured and overwhelmed by immeasurable afflictions.

analyzed: gal te nam nyon mongs pa zad pa na de'i tshe gsal bar mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba ni /

original: ji ltar gyad des me long gsal ba'i nang du nor bu rin po che mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gyad des me long gsal ba'i nang du nor bu rin po che mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the strongman seeing the jewel in the clear mirror.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni de ltar tshad med de bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: the tathāgatagarbha is thus immeasurable and inconceivable.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: it is also like this:

analyzed: dper na / gangs kyi ri la sman bde ba zhes bya ba'i ro yod do //

original: de'i ro ni shin tu mngar te /
analyzed: de'i ro ni shin tu mngar te /

original: nags stug po'i drung du skye bas mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: nags stug po'i drung du skye bas mthong bar mi nus so //
translated: It grows in the depths of the forest, so it cannot be seen.

original: de la dri bro ba tsam gyis gnas de na sman de yod par shes so //
analyzed: de la dri bro ba tsam gyis gnas de na sman de yod par shes so //
translated: By the mere smell, one knows that this medicine is there.🔽In the past, a universal monarch,

analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i dus na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po zhig sman de 'dod pa'i @180b phyir gangs kyi ri de la gnas kun du shing gi wa btsugs nas sman zags pa bzed do //

analyzed: sman de nam smin pa na chu bzhin du sa la zags pas shing gi wa bzed pa'i nang du'ang zags te /

analyzed: ro de ni yang dag pa'o //

original: rgyal po de 'das pa'i 'og tu ni sman de'i ro bar 'ga' ni skyur /🔽bar 'ga' ni lan tshva /
analyzed: rgyal po de 'das pa'i 'og tu ni sman de'i ro bar 'ga' ni skyur / bar 'ga' ni lan tshva /

original: bar 'ga' ni mngar /🔽bar 'ga' ni kha /
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni mngar / bar 'ga' ni kha /
translated: sometimes sweet,🔽sometimes bitter,

original: bar 'ga' ni tsha /
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni tsha /

original: bar 'ga' ni bska'o //
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni bska'o //

analyzed: de ltar ro gcig po de'ang gar zags pa'i gnas las rnam pa tha dad du gyur te /
translated: Thus, that single taste, depending on where it dripped, became of different types.

original: sman de'i ro nyid ni ri la yod do //🔽dper na / zla ba rgyas pa ni bsod nams chung ba dag gis shin tu nyam thag par las su byas te /
analyzed: sman de'i ro nyid ni ri la yod do // dper na / zla ba rgyas pa ni bsod nams chung ba dag gis shin tu nyam thag par las su byas te /
translated: The taste of the medicine is in the mountain.

original: 'jor gyis brkos kyang thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'jor gyis brkos kyang thob par mi nus so //
translated: For example, the full moon is so weak that those with little merit cannot obtain it even by digging with a hoe.

analyzed: gal te rgyal po 'phags pa dag 'jig rten du byung na bsod nams kyi rkyen gyis sman de'i ro'ang yang dag par 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a noble king appears in the world, by the condition of merit, the taste of that medicine will be obtained.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i ro'ang de dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nags stug pos bsgribs pas sems can ma rig pa dag gis mthong bar mi nus so //

analyzed: sman ro gcig pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi dpe ste /

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ro rnam pa sna tshogs su gyur pa ni /
translated: Due to the power of afflictions, it becomes various tastes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / byol song dang / lha dang / mi dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning dang / rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / rigs ngan gdol pa la sogs par @181a *//
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / byol song dang / lha dang / mi dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning dang / rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / rigs ngan gdol pa la sogs par @181a *//
translated: They are born as hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals, gods, humans, men, women, eunuchs, members of the warrior caste, Brahmins, and low-caste outcasts.

analyzed: gyur pa'o // sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni shin tu dpa' bas de bas na gsod mi nus so //

analyzed: ci ste bsad na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin med par byas pa yin no; ;sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis med par byed nus pa ma yin te /

original: med par bya ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: med par bya ba'i gnas med do //

analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po'o //
translated: The nature of the self is the secret essence of the Tathāgata.

original: de ltar gsang ba'i snying po de ni gang gis kyang 'jig cing med par byed nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gsang ba'i snying po de ni gang gis kyang 'jig cing med par byed nus pa ma yin te /
translated: This secret essence cannot be destroyed or annihilated by anyone.

original: med par byed mi nus kyang mthong bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: med par byed mi nus kyang mthong bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Although it cannot be destroyed, it is not suitable to be seen.

analyzed: gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas na rtogs shing rig par 'gyur te /
translated: If one attains perfect enlightenment, one will realize and understand.

original: de bas na gsod nus pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na gsod nus pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no one who can kill.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha told Kāśyapa:

original: yang dag par na gsod pa yod do //
analyzed: yang dag par na gsod pa yod do //
translated: “There is killing in reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

analyzed: sems can gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni phung po lnga la gnas te /

analyzed: gal te phung po lnga bshig na srog bcad pa zhes bya'o //

original: gal te srog bcad na ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te srog bcad na ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one kills, one will fall into the evil realms.

original: las kyi rgyu dang rkyen gyis rgyal rigs dang / bram ze la sogs pa dang / rigs ngan gdol pa dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning dang / srid pa nyi shu lnga po @181b la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'khor bar 'khor ro //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu dang rkyen gyis rgyal rigs dang / bram ze la sogs pa dang / rigs ngan gdol pa dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning dang / srid pa nyi shu lnga po @181b la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'khor bar 'khor ro //
translated: Because of the causes and conditions of karma, one transmigrates in saṃsāra through the characteristics of the different types, such as the kṣatriya, the brahmin, and so on, the low-caste untouchables, men, women, neuters, the twenty-five existences, and so on.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa dag ni bdag ces bya ba'i mtshan nyid chen po dang / chung ngu dang / til lam /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa dag ni bdag ces bya ba'i mtshan nyid chen po dang / chung ngu dang / til lam /

original: khre'am / sran ma'am /
analyzed: khre'am / sran ma'am /
translated: a mustard seed, a bean,

original: mthe bo'i bar du rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: mthe bo'i bar du rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dzin te /
translated: or a thumb, and so on.

analyzed: gang mi bden pa'i sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: Grasping at the characteristics of an unreal illusion is not correct.

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'da' ba'i bdag gi mtshan nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa ni shin tu mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, grasping at a self is said to be supreme.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: it is also like this:

analyzed: sems can gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The buddha-nature of sentient beings is also like this.

analyzed: phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid ni byed pa dang bcas pa'o //

analyzed: byed pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid ni rdo'am gseg ma lta bu ste /

analyzed: 'bigs shing gcod nus so //

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni rdo rje lta bu ste /

translated: Son of good family!🔽You should know that the Buddha Dharma is like this,

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde ni bdud rtsi lta bu'ang yin la /

analyzed: de bas na ngas rim gyis yang dag pa'i chos bstan to; ;gzhan yang yang dag pa'i dge 'dun ma yin pa la skyabs su song ba dag la yang dag pa'i dge 'dun dag la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas kyang byed do // gang dkon mchog gsum la bye brag 'byed pa dag la ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas cig ste /
translated: Moreover, I make those who have taken refuge in the false Sangha take refuge in the true Sangha.

original: gsum du bye brag med do zhes kyang ston to //
analyzed: gsum du bye brag med do zhes kyang ston to //
translated: For those who discriminate among the Three Jewels, I teach that there is no discrimination among the Three Jewels.

original: dmus long ldongs par gyur pa la ni mig lta bur yang ston to //
analyzed: dmus long ldongs par gyur pa la ni mig lta bur yang ston to //
translated: I also teach that the Three Jewels are like eyes for the blind and the sightless.

original: gzhan yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas yang dag pa'ang bya'o snyam sems so //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas yang dag pa'ang bya'o snyam sems so //
translated: Moreover, I think that I should make those who take refuge in the Hearers' and Solitary Buddhas' vehicles take true refuge.

original: rigs kyi bu //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu //
translated: Son of noble family!

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dag ni sems can ma rungs pa tshad med pa dang mkhas pa shes rab can dag gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dag ni sems can ma rungs pa tshad med pa dang mkhas pa shes rab can dag gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas perform the deeds of the Buddha for the sake of immeasurable evil sentient beings and for the sake of the wise and the learned.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: dper na / skyes bu zhig g-yul ngor phyin pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu zhig g-yul ngor phyin pa'i tshe /
translated: it is like a man who goes to war.

original: 'di snyam du bdag ni mchog ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag ni mchog ste /
translated: He thinks, “I am the best.

original: dmag gi tshogs 'di dag thams cad kyang bdag 'ba' zhig la ltos so snyam sems so //
analyzed: dmag gi tshogs 'di dag thams cad kyang bdag 'ba' zhig la ltos so snyam sems so //
translated: All these troops depend on me alone.”

original: gzhan yang dper na /🔽rgyal tshab gzhon nu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na / rgyal tshab gzhon nu 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Again, it is like

original: bdag ni rgyal bu thams cad thul te /
analyzed: bdag ni rgyal bu thams cad thul te /
translated: the crown prince who thinks, “I have subdued all the princes.

original: rgyal po chen po'i srid dang / dbang ba thams cad la bdag dbang du gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po'i srid dang / dbang ba thams cad la bdag dbang du gyur te /
translated: I have control over the great king’s realm and all his possessions.

original: rgyal bu thams cad kyang bdag la phyogs pas /
analyzed: rgyal bu thams cad kyang bdag la phyogs pas /
translated: All the princes are on my side.

original: @185a *// de bas na zhan pa'i bsam pa mi skyed do snyam du sems te /
analyzed: @185a *// de bas na zhan pa'i bsam pa mi skyed do snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore, I will not give rise to inferior thoughts.”

original: ji ltar rgyal po dang rgyal bu de bzhin du blon po chen po'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po dang rgyal bu de bzhin du blon po chen po'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the king and the prince are like this, so too is the great minister.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang de dang 'dra bar 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang de dang 'dra bar 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva is also like this, thinking:

original: ji ltar na dngos po gsum po bdag dang rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur snyam sems so //
analyzed: ji ltar na dngos po gsum po bdag dang rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur snyam sems so //
translated: How can these three things become one with the self-nature?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: ngas bstan pa'i dngos po gsum po 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: ngas bstan pa'i dngos po gsum po 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bla na med pa'i skyes bu dam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bla na med pa'i skyes bu dam pa ste /

original: ji ltar mi'i lus la yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad kyi ngan na mgo bo dam pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mi'i lus la yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad kyi ngan na mgo bo dam pa ste /
translated: just as in a human body, the head is supreme among all the limbs and secondary limbs,

original: gzhan ma yin pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang de dang 'dra bar mchog dam pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang de dang 'dra bar mchog dam pa ste /
translated: and is not different. The Buddha is also like this, supreme and sublime,

original: chos dang / dge 'dun ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dang / dge 'dun ni ma yin no //
translated: but the Dharma and Saṅgha are not.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams bsgral ba'i phyir mtshan nyid rnam pa sna tshogs su skas kyi them pa ltar bye brag tu bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams bsgral ba'i phyir mtshan nyid rnam pa sna tshogs su skas kyi them pa ltar bye brag tu bstan to //
translated: In order to liberate worldly people, various characteristics are taught distinctly, like the steps of a staircase.

original: de bas na khyod ni gus pa glen pa ltar /
analyzed: de bas na khyod ni gus pa glen pa ltar /
translated: Therefore, you should be like a fool with respect,

original: dkon mchog gsum la tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du mi gzung ngo //
translated: Do not hold the Three Jewels to be different characteristics.

original: khyod ni theg pa chen po la zhugs shing dbang po rno ba ni ral gri rnon po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: khyod ni theg pa chen po la zhugs shing dbang po rno ba ni ral gri rnon po dang 'dra'o //
translated: You have entered the Great Vehicle and your faculties are sharp, like a sharp sword.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Blessed One:

original: bdag ni rtogs bzhin du bcem ldan 'das la zhu ba lags kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni rtogs bzhin du bcem ldan 'das la zhu ba lags kyi /
translated: I ask the Blessed One while understanding,

original: mi 'tshal ba ni ma lags te /
analyzed: mi 'tshal ba ni ma lags te /
translated: not out of ignorance.

original: bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig dpa' zhing dbang po rtul phod pa rnams kyi slad du dri ma mchis @185b pa yongs su dag pa'i spyod yul du zhugs pa lags so //
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig dpa' zhing dbang po rtul phod pa rnams kyi slad du dri ma mchis @185b pa yongs su dag pa'i spyod yul du zhugs pa lags so //
translated: I ask for the sake of those bodhisattvas who are brave and have sharp faculties, in order to enter the domain that is stainless and completely pure.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ngo mtshar rmad kyi dngos po 'byed cing bstan pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde bsngags pa'i slad du zhugs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ngo mtshar rmad kyi dngos po 'byed cing bstan pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde bsngags pa'i slad du zhugs te /
translated: Moreover, I ask in order to reveal and teach the wondrous and marvelous things of the Tathāgata, and in order to praise the extensive sūtras of the Great Vehicle.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thugs rje chen pos legs par gsungs pas bdag kyang de la bde bar gnas par 'tshal lo; ;gang na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul la yongs su dag pa ston pa de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde ston
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thugs rje chen pos legs par gsungs pas bdag kyang de la bde bar gnas par 'tshal lo; ;gang na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul la yongs su dag pa ston pa de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde ston
translated: The Tathāgata has spoken well with great compassion, and I too wish to abide in it with ease.

original: pa lags so //
analyzed: pa lags so //
translated: Where the domain of the bodhisattvas is taught with purity, that is the teaching of the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po 'di sems can thams cad la rgyas par bstan cing /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po 'di sems can thams cad la rgyas par bstan cing /
translated: I too will extensively teach this secret essence of the Tathāgata to all sentient beings,

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas yang dag par rtogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas yang dag par rtogs par bgyi'o //
translated: and will realize the basis of going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de la sems can gang zhig 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde 'di la dad cing yid ches na /
analyzed: de la sems can gang zhig 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde 'di la dad cing yid ches na /
translated: Among them, any sentient being who has faith and confidence in this noble Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra,

original: skyes bu de ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas rtogs shing khong du chud pa lags so //
analyzed: skyes bu de ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas rtogs shing khong du chud pa lags so //
translated: that person will realize and comprehend the basis of going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the essence of the Tathāgata’s secret is the nature of the Buddha.

original: gang mdo sde 'di ston cing 'chad pa de'i lus la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma mchis par smra ste /
analyzed: gang mdo sde 'di ston cing 'chad pa de'i lus la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma mchis par smra ste /
translated: If one says that the body of one who teaches and explains this sūtra does not have the nature of the Buddha,

original: skyes bu de ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ma yin pa gzhan mi tshol lo //
analyzed: skyes bu de ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ma yin pa gzhan mi tshol lo //
translated: that person does not go for refuge to the Three Jewels and does not seek anything else.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyi ma ma 'ongs @186a *//
analyzed: phyi ma ma 'ongs @186a *//
translated: In the future,

original: pa'i dus su bdag gi lus 'di nyid dkon mchog gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'i dus su bdag gi lus 'di nyid dkon mchog gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: this very body of mine will become the Three Jewels.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de ma yin pa'i skye bo gzhan thams cad kyang bdag la brten te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de ma yin pa'i skye bo gzhan thams cad kyang bdag la brten te /
translated: All śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and other beings will rely on me

original: rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and will pay homage, respect, and make offerings to me.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: don de lta bas na theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la yang dag par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: don de lta bas na theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la yang dag par bslab par bya'o //
translated: for that reason, you should train in the Mahāyāna sūtras.”

original: 'od srung gis yang gsol pa /
analyzed: 'od srung gis yang gsol pa /
translated: Kāśyapa then said,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The nature of the Buddha is inconceivable.

original: de bzhin du mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'ang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'ang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: Likewise, the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks are inconceivable.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung la legs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung la legs so //
translated: Then the World-Honored One praised Kasyapa:

original: shin tu legs so /🔽zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: shin tu legs so / zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: “Very good, very good!

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good man,

original: khyod ni shin tu zab pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas /
analyzed: khyod ni shin tu zab pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas /
translated: you are endowed with profound wisdom.

original: ngas kyang khyod kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la 'jug pa legs par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ngas kyang khyod kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la 'jug pa legs par bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will now explain to you the entry into the Tathagata-garbha.

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba ther zug tu rtag pa'i chos yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba ther zug tu rtag pa'i chos yin na ni /
translated: If the so-called self is a permanent dharma,

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it cannot be separated from suffering.

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba med na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba med na ni /
translated: If the so-called self does not exist,

original: tshangs par spyod pa dag pa na pa'i don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dag pa na pa'i don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the practice of pure conduct will be meaningless.

original: gal te chos thams cad bdag med par smra na de ni chad par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad bdag med par smra na de ni chad par lta ba yin no //
translated: If you say that all dharmas are without self, then that is the view of annihilation.

original: ci ste bdag ces bya ba ther zug tu smra na de ni rtag par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: ci ste bdag ces bya ba ther zug tu smra na de ni rtag par lta ba yin no //
translated: If one asserts that the self is permanent, that is the view of eternalism.

original: gang 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par lta na de'ang chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par lta na de'ang chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one views all conditioned things as impermanent, that is the view of annihilationism.

original: 'du byed rtag par lta na /
analyzed: 'du byed rtag par lta na /
translated: If one views conditioned things as permanent,

original: @186b de'ang rtag par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @186b de'ang rtag par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: that is the view of eternalism.

original: gang sdug bsngal bar smra na chad par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal bar smra na chad par lta ba yin no //
translated: If one asserts that there is suffering, that is the view of annihilationism.

original: gal te bde bar smra na'ang rtag par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te bde bar smra na'ang rtag par lta ba yin no //
translated: If one asserts that there is happiness, that is the view of eternalism.

original: yang chos thams cad mi rtag go bar nan tan byed na chad par lta bar ltung ngo //
analyzed: yang chos thams cad mi rtag go bar nan tan byed na chad par lta bar ltung ngo //
translated: If one practices the view that all phenomena are impermanent, one will fall into the view of annihilationism.

original: chos thams cad rtag go bar nan tan byed na rtag par lta bar ltung ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad rtag go bar nan tan byed na rtag par lta bar ltung ngo //
translated: If one practices the view that all phenomena are permanent, one will fall into the view of eternalism.

original: dper na / srin bu khung bur 'gro ba dag rkang pa snga ma ber nas rkang pa phyi ma 'dor ro //
analyzed: dper na / srin bu khung bur 'gro ba dag rkang pa snga ma ber nas rkang pa phyi ma 'dor ro //
translated: For example, when an insect moves through a hole, it moves its back legs based on its front legs.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa la nan tan byed pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa la nan tan byed pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Those who practice eternalism and annihilationism are like that.

original: chad pa dang / rtag pa'i rkyen la rtogs dgos so //
analyzed: chad pa dang / rtag pa'i rkyen la rtogs dgos so //
translated: They must understand the conditions of annihilationism and eternalism.

original: don de lta bas na sdug bsngal ba'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: don de lta bas na sdug bsngal ba'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: For this reason, to be diligent in other teachings of suffering is nonvirtuous.

original: bde ba'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: To be diligent in other teachings of happiness is called virtuous.

original: bdag med pa'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin no /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin no /
translated: To be diligent in other teachings of selflessness is the side of affliction.

original: rtag pa'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po zhes bya ste /
translated: To be diligent in other teachings of permanence is called the secret essence of the Tathāgata.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gnas dang rten med pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gnas dang rten med pa'o //
translated: Nirvāṇa has no location or support.

original: mi rtag pa'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni rdzas dang / zang zing yod pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni rdzas dang / zang zing yod pa'o //
translated: To be diligent in other teachings of impermanence is to have substance and material things.

original: rtag pa'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / yang dag par rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos gzhan la nan tan byed pa ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / yang dag par rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: To be diligent in other teachings of permanence is the Buddha, the Dharma, the Saṅgha, and true liberation.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni lam dbu ma mtha' gnyis dang yongs su bral ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni lam dbu ma mtha' gnyis dang yongs su bral ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should know that the Buddha-nature is the middle path, completely free from the two extremes.

original: yang dag pa'i chos bstan pa la bus pa ma rabs dag ni de la the tshom ma byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos bstan pa la bus pa ma rabs dag ni de la the tshom ma byed do //
translated: “You should not doubt the true teaching.

original: dper na / nad pa nyam chung ba dag mar @187a *//
analyzed: dper na / nad pa nyam chung ba dag mar @187a *//
translated: For example, a weak and sick person

original: 'thungs na lus yang zhing dkar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thungs na lus yang zhing dkar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: who drinks ghee will be cured and his body will become light and strong.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i chos kyang rang bzhin gcig tu ma chad de /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i chos kyang rang bzhin gcig tu ma chad de /
translated: The existence and nonexistence of dharmas are not determined by a single nature.

original: dper na / chen po bzhi rang bzhin mi mthun pas gcig gi gnyen por gcig 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / chen po bzhi rang bzhin mi mthun pas gcig gi gnyen por gcig 'gyur te /
translated: For example, the four great elements have different natures and one can be the antidote for another.

original: de la sman pa mkhas pas ni gang gi shas che ba bzhin du shin tu rtogs so //
analyzed: de la sman pa mkhas pas ni gang gi shas che ba bzhin du shin tu rtogs so //
translated: A skilled physician can understand very well which one is predominant.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is also like this.

original: sems can thams cad la sman pa lta bur kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa tha dad pa mkhyen pas yongs su gsal te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sman pa lta bur kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa tha dad pa mkhyen pas yongs su gsal te /
translated: He is like a physician to all sentient beings. He understands the different natures of the afflictions and illuminates them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gsang ba'i snying po sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gsang ba'i snying po sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba ston to //
translated: He teaches the secret essence of the Tathāgata, the purity of the Buddha-nature, which is unchanging and unmoving.

original: gal te yod par smra na mkhas pa shes rab can dag chags pa'i mi rigs la /
analyzed: gal te yod par smra na mkhas pa shes rab can dag chags pa'i mi rigs la /
translated: If one says that it exists, then the wise and the intelligent would not be attached to it.

original: gal te med par smra na brdzun du smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te med par smra na brdzun du smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says that it does not exist, then one would be speaking falsely.

original: gal te yod par smra na 'phags pa cang mi smra ba'i mi rigs la /
analyzed: gal te yod par smra na 'phags pa cang mi smra ba'i mi rigs la /
translated: If one says that it exists, then the noble ones would not be speaking of non-existence.

original: gzhan yang khyal ba dang / rtsod par smra ba'i mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyal ba dang / rtsod par smra ba'i mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it would be inappropriate to speak of it as something to be argued about.

original: yang dag pa'i chos nyid rtogs par 'dod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos nyid rtogs par 'dod do //
translated: One should wish to realize the true nature of reality.

original: bus pa ma rabs ni khyal bar smra zhing rtsod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po mi shes so //
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs ni khyal bar smra zhing rtsod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po mi shes so //
translated: Foolish and ignorant people argue and speak of it as something to be argued about, and thus they do not understand the secret essence of the Tathāgata.

original: gal te sdug bsngal bar smra na bus pa glen pa dag lus 'di mi rtag go snyam sems so //
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal bar smra na bus pa glen pa dag lus 'di mi rtag go snyam sems so //
translated: If one says that it is suffering, then foolish and ignorant people will think that this body is impermanent.

original: thams cad sdug bsngal bar smra na lus la bde ba'i rang bzhin yod par mi shes so //
analyzed: thams cad sdug bsngal bar smra na lus la bde ba'i rang bzhin yod par mi shes so //
translated: If one says that everything is suffering, then one will not understand that the body has a nature of bliss.

original: gal te mi rtag par smra na bus pa glen pa dag lus thams cad mi rtag go @187b snyam ste /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par smra na bus pa glen pa dag lus thams cad mi rtag go @187b snyam ste /
translated: If one says that it is impermanent, then foolish and ignorant people will think that the entire body is impermanent.

original: rdza so ma btang ba dang 'dra bar 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdza so ma btang ba dang 'dra bar 'dzin to //
translated: They will hold it to be like an unfired clay pot.

original: de la mkhas pa shes rab can dag ni rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: de la mkhas pa shes rab can dag ni rnam par phye ste /
translated: The wise and the learned, however, distinguish these.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du mi rtag par mi smra'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du mi rtag par mi smra'o //
translated: They do not say that everything is impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bdag gi lus la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seed of the Buddha-nature exists in one’s own body.

original: gal te bdag med par smra na bus pa glen pa dag sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bdag med do snyam du 'dzin to //🔽mkhas pa shes rab can ni bdag med pa bla dvags su btags par zad de /
analyzed: gal te bdag med par smra na bus pa glen pa dag sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bdag med do snyam du 'dzin to // mkhas pa shes rab can ni bdag med pa bla dvags su btags par zad de /
translated: If one advocates nonself, the ignorant and foolish will grasp at the idea that all the qualities of the Buddha are nonexistent.

original: bden pa med par rnam par dbye'o //
analyzed: bden pa med par rnam par dbye'o //
translated: The wise and the learned, however, will understand that nonself is a designation and that there is no truth in it.

original: de ltar shes nas de la the tshom mi skyed do //🔽gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po stong par smra na bus pa glen pa dag thos nas chad pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar shes nas de la the tshom mi skyed do // gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po stong par smra na bus pa glen pa dag thos nas chad pa'am /
translated: Knowing this, they will not give rise to doubt.

original: med par lta ba skye'o //
analyzed: med par lta ba skye'o //
translated: If one advocates that the essence of the Tathāgata is empty, the ignorant and foolish will give rise to the view of annihilation or nonexistence when they hear this.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho bar bye brag dbye'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho bar bye brag dbye'o //
translated: The wise and the learned, however, will understand that the Tathāgata is permanent, unchanging, and immutable.

original: gal te rnam par grol ba sgyu ma lta bur smra na bus pa glen pa dag rnam par grol ba thob pa rnams bdud kyi chos yin no snyam du 'dzin to //
analyzed: gal te rnam par grol ba sgyu ma lta bur smra na bus pa glen pa dag rnam par grol ba thob pa rnams bdud kyi chos yin no snyam du 'dzin to //
translated: If you say that liberation is like an illusion, the foolish and ignorant will think that those who have attained liberation are subject to the power of Mara.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rnam par phye ste /
translated: The wise and the learned, however, will understand it as it really is.

original: mi'i nang na seng ge lta bur de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig ni rtag pa gnas pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho bar dbye'o //
analyzed: mi'i nang na seng ge lta bur de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig ni rtag pa gnas pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho bar dbye'o //
translated: Only the Tathagata, the Lion of Men, is permanent, steadfast, and unchanging.

original: gal te ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams byung bar smra na /🔽byis pa glen pa dag thos nas rig pa dang / ma rig par chos gnyis su bye brag 'byed do //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams byung bar smra na / byis pa glen pa dag thos nas rig pa dang / ma rig par chos gnyis su bye brag 'byed do //
translated: If you say that the conditioning of ignorance gives rise to volitions,🔽the foolish and ignorant will think that ignorance and knowledge are two separate things.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs so //
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs so //
translated: The wise and the learned, however, will understand that by nature they are nondual.

original: gang gnyis su med pa dag ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gnyis su med pa dag ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: That which is nondual is the true reality.

original: gal te @188a *//
analyzed: gal te @188a *//
translated: If you say that the eye is impermanent,

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung bar smra na bus pa glen pa dag 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gnyis su 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung bar smra na bus pa glen pa dag 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gnyis su 'dzin to //
translated: If you say that consciousness arises due to the condition of volitions, then the childish and ignorant grasp at the duality of volitions and consciousness.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs te /
translated: The wise and the learned, however, realize the absence of duality by nature.

original: gnyis su med pa ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of duality is reality.

original: gal te dge ba bcu dang / mi dge ba bcu po 'di ni bya ba'i rigs /
analyzed: gal te dge ba bcu dang / mi dge ba bcu po 'di ni bya ba'i rigs /
translated: If you say that these ten virtues and ten nonvirtues are to be done,

original: 'di ni mi bya ba'i rigs /
analyzed: 'di ni mi bya ba'i rigs /
translated: and that these are not to be done,

original: 'di ni mtho ris kyi lam /
analyzed: 'di ni mtho ris kyi lam /
translated: that this is the path to the higher realms,

original: 'di ni ngan song gi rgyud /
analyzed: 'di ni ngan song gi rgyud /
translated: that this is the cause for the lower realms,

original: 'di ni rnam par dkar ba'i chos /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par dkar ba'i chos /
translated: that this is the pure Dharma,

original: 'di ni chos nag po'i zhes smra na bus pa glen pa dag gnyis su 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nag po'i zhes smra na bus pa glen pa dag gnyis su 'dzin to //
translated: and that this is the dark Dharma, then the childish and ignorant grasp at duality.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs te /
translated: The wise and the learned, however, realize the absence of duality by nature.

original: gnyis su med pa ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of duality is reality.

original: gal te chos thams cad sdug bsngal bar nan tan bya'o zhes smra na bus pa glen pa dag gnyis su 'dzin to //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad sdug bsngal bar nan tan bya'o zhes smra na bus pa glen pa dag gnyis su 'dzin to //
translated: If one were to insist that all things are suffering, the childish and ignorant would grasp at duality.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs te /
translated: The wise and the learned, however, understand that by nature there is no duality.

original: gnyis su med pa ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of duality is reality.

original: gal te 'du byed thams cad mi rtag ce'am /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed thams cad mi rtag ce'am /
translated: If one were to say that all compounded things are impermanent,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'ang mi rtag ces smra na bus pa glen pa dag gnyis su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'ang mi rtag ces smra na bus pa glen pa dag gnyis su 'dzin to //
translated: or that even the essence of the Tathāgata is impermanent, the childish and ignorant would grasp at duality.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par rtogs te /
translated: The wise and the learned, however, understand that by nature there is no duality.

original: gnyis su med pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of duality is reality.

original: chos thams cad bdag med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med de /
translated: All things are without self.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yang dag pa med ces smra na bus pa glen pa dag gnyis su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yang dag pa med ces smra na bus pa glen pa dag gnyis su 'dzin to //
translated: If one were to say that even the essence of the Tathāgata is not real, the childish and ignorant would grasp at duality.

original: @188b mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par chogs te /
analyzed: @188b mkhas pa shes rab can ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par chogs te /
translated: The wise and the learned, however, understand that by nature there is no duality.

original: gnyis su med pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: Non-duality is reality.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med do //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med do //
translated: Self and non-self are essentially non-dual.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i don ni de ltar dpag tu med cing tshad med mtha' yas par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su bsngags pas ngas kyang yon tan dang ldan pa'i mdo sde thams cad las kyang rgyas par gsungs so ////
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i don ni de ltar dpag tu med cing tshad med mtha' yas par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su bsngags pas ngas kyang yon tan dang ldan pa'i mdo sde thams cad las kyang rgyas par gsungs so ////
translated: The meaning of the essence of the Tathāgata is thus praised by the Blessed Buddhas as immeasurable, limitless, and infinite. I have also extensively taught it in all the sūtras endowed with good qualities.

original: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: Noble Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra

original: bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: Eleventh section

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med pa rang bzhin gyis gnyis pa med par khyod kyis de ltar gzungs su gzung la skye bos long zhig /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med pa rang bzhin gyis gnyis pa med par khyod kyis de ltar gzungs su gzung la skye bos long zhig /
translated: you should hold this as a dhāraṇī: 'Self' and 'non-self' are essentially non-dual. You should hold it thus and proclaim it to others.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: khyod kyis mdo sde 'di brtan par gzungs su gzung la dran par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis mdo sde 'di brtan par gzungs su gzung la dran par gyis shig /
translated: you should firmly hold this sūtra as a dhāraṇī and remember it.

original: ngas sngon 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'i mdo sde las kyang bdag dang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis su med par bstan to //
analyzed: ngas sngon 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'i mdo sde las kyang bdag dang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis su med par bstan to //
translated: I have also taught in the noble Great Sutra of the Perfection of Wisdom that [the two truths] are not dual in terms of the characteristics of self and selflessness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'o ma las zho 'byung ba dang / zho las mar 'byung ba dang / mar las zhun mar 'byung ba dang / zhun mar las mar gyi snying po 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'o ma las zho 'byung ba dang / zho las mar 'byung ba dang / mar las zhun mar 'byung ba dang / zhun mar las mar gyi snying po 'byung ste /
translated: From milk come curd, butter, and ghee.

original: de ltar zho'i rang bzhin de 'o ma las byung ngam /
analyzed: de ltar zho'i rang bzhin de 'o ma las byung ngam /
translated: Is the nature of curd in milk?

original: log te zho nyid las byung ngam /
analyzed: log te zho nyid las byung ngam /
translated: Or is it in curd?🔽Or is it in something else?

original: 'on te gzhan nas byung ba mar gyi snying po'i bar du'ang de bzhin du rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan nas byung ba mar gyi snying po'i bar du'ang de bzhin du rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood in detail up to ghee.

original: gal te gzhan las byung na gzhan gyis byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan las byung na gzhan gyis byas pa yin te /
translated: If it comes from something else, it is produced by something else.

original: gzhan @189a *// gyis byas na 'o ma las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan @189a *// gyis byas na 'o ma las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is produced by something else, it does not come from milk.

original: gal te 'o ma las ma byung na 'o ma cir yang mi dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'o ma las ma byung na 'o ma cir yang mi dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not come from milk, milk would serve no purpose at all.

original: gal te zho nyid las byung na 'dra ba'i yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te zho nyid las byung na 'dra ba'i yang mi rigs te /
translated: If it were to arise from the milk itself, it would not be reasonable for it to be similar.

original: gal te mar gyi snying po 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te mar gyi snying po 'byung ste /
translated: If it were to arise from the essence of butter,

original: rgyun las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would arise from a continuum.

original: gal te rgyun las skyes na /
analyzed: gal te rgyun las skyes na /
translated: If it were to arise from a continuum,

original: lhan cig skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: it would not arise simultaneously.

original: gal te lhan cig ma skyes na ro rnam pa lnga dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig ma skyes na ro rnam pa lnga dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i rigs te /
translated: If it did not arise simultaneously, it would be reasonable for the five flavors to occur at one time.

original: dus gcig tu byung ba'ang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dus gcig tu byung ba'ang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: But they do not occur at one time.

original: nges par gzhan nas 'ongs pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par gzhan nas 'ongs pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not definitely coming from somewhere else.

original: de bas na 'o ma'i nang na mngar ba'i ro che bas snga nas zho'i mtshan nyid yod kyang rang 'gyur bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de bas na 'o ma'i nang na mngar ba'i ro che bas snga nas zho'i mtshan nyid yod kyang rang 'gyur bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since the sweet flavor is predominant in the milk, the characteristics of the curd are already present, but it is not able to transform by itself.

original: de bzhin du mar gyi snying po'i bar du rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mar gyi snying po'i bar du rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood in detail up to the essence of butter.

original: brtsva zos pa dang / chu 'thungs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis khrag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtsva zos pa dang / chu 'thungs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis khrag tu 'gyur te /
translated: The cause and condition of eating grass and drinking water transforms into blood.

original: khrag las 'o mar gyur to //
analyzed: khrag las 'o mar gyur to //
translated: From blood it becomes milk.

original: gal te rtsva mngar ba zos na 'o ma'ang mngar ro //
analyzed: gal te rtsva mngar ba zos na 'o ma'ang mngar ro //
translated: If sweet grass is eaten, the milk will also be sweet.

original: gal te rtsva kha ba zos na 'o ma yang kha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rtsva kha ba zos na 'o ma yang kha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats grass that is bitter, the milk will be bitter.

original: gangs kyi ri la rtsva snum pa zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: gangs kyi ri la rtsva snum pa zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: On the snow mountains there is a kind of grass called “nourishing.”

original: gal te bas zos na mar gyi snying po 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bas zos na mar gyi snying po 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur te /
translated: If cows eat it, the milk will be rich in cream.

original: kha dog sngon po'am /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po'am /
translated: The color of the milk will not be blue,

original: ser po'am / dmar po'am /
analyzed: ser po'am / dmar po'am /
translated: yellow, red,

original: dkar po'am / nag por ni mi mngon no //
analyzed: dkar po'am / nag por ni mi mngon no //
translated: white, or black.

original: rtsva gzhan zos pa'i rgyu dang rkyen las 'o ma'i ro dang / kha dog kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsva gzhan zos pa'i rgyu dang rkyen las 'o ma'i ro dang / kha dog kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The taste and color of the milk will be different because of the different kinds of grass that the cows have eaten.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag rig pa dang / ma rig pa'i las kyi rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid gnyis @189b bskyed do //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag rig pa dang / ma rig pa'i las kyi rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid gnyis @189b bskyed do //
translated: The causes and conditions of the karma of ignorance and of wisdom are both produced by the ignorant, ordinary person.

original: gal te ma rig pa las bzlog na rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa las bzlog na rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If one turns away from ignorance, it is called wisdom.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang dge ba dang / mi dge ba zhes bya ba mtshan nyid gnyis su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang dge ba dang / mi dge ba zhes bya ba mtshan nyid gnyis su med do //
translated: In the same way, all dharmas are not two characteristics, called good and bad.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kāśyapa addressed the Buddha, saying:🔽“World-honored One, the Tathāgata has said that the causes and conditions of the karma of ignorance and of wisdom are both produced by the ignorant, ordinary person.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar 'o ma'i nang na zho mchis zhes bgyi ba'i don ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar 'o ma'i nang na zho mchis zhes bgyi ba'i don ji lta bu lags /
translated: As the Buddha has said, ‘Milk contains curd.’ What is the meaning of this?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: World-Honored One,

original: ci ste 'o ma'i nang na zho'i rang bzhin nges par mchis la /
analyzed: ci ste 'o ma'i nang na zho'i rang bzhin nges par mchis la /
translated: if milk definitely contains the nature of curd,

original: shin tu phra bas mi mthong na ci'i slad du 'o ma'i rkyen gyis zho 'byung ngo zhes gsungs /
analyzed: shin tu phra bas mi mthong na ci'i slad du 'o ma'i rkyen gyis zho 'byung ngo zhes gsungs /
translated: because it is too subtle to be seen, why did you say that curd comes from the condition of milk?

original: chos thog ma nas ma mchis na ni skyes zhes bgyir rung na /
analyzed: chos thog ma nas ma mchis na ni skyes zhes bgyir rung na /
translated: If a thing did not exist from the beginning, it could be said to be born.

original: snga nas mchis pa zhig lags na ci'i slad du skyes zhes bka' stsal /
analyzed: snga nas mchis pa zhig lags na ci'i slad du skyes zhes bka' stsal /
translated: If it existed before, why did you say it was born?

original: ci ste 'o ma'i nang na zho'i rang bzhin mchis par nges na rtsi shing thams cad kyi nang na'ang 'o ma mchis pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste 'o ma'i nang na zho'i rang bzhin mchis par nges na rtsi shing thams cad kyi nang na'ang 'o ma mchis pa'i rigs so //
translated: If milk definitely contains the nature of curd, then all plants should contain milk.

original: de bzhin du 'o ma'i nang na'ang rtsi shing mchis par 'gyur ro //🔽ci ste 'o ma'i nang na nges par zho ma mchis pa zhig lags na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'o ma'i nang na'ang rtsi shing mchis par 'gyur ro // ci ste 'o ma'i nang na nges par zho ma mchis pa zhig lags na /
translated: In the same way, milk should contain plants.🔽If milk definitely does not contain curd,

original: ci'i slad du 'o ma'i rkyen gyis zho 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i slad du 'o ma'i rkyen gyis zho 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: why do you say that curd comes from the condition of milk?

original: gal te chos kyang snga nas ma mchis la /
analyzed: gal te chos kyang snga nas ma mchis la /
translated: If dharmas do not exist previously,

original: phyis skyes pa zhig lags na ci'i slad du 'o ma'i nang na rtsi shing mi skye /
analyzed: phyis skyes pa zhig lags na ci'i slad du 'o ma'i nang na rtsi shing mi skye /
translated: and are born later, why do plants not grow in milk?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

analyzed: gzhan yang aee zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa gshegs sam /

analyzed: de ni aee zhes bya'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su bcad pas ao zhes bya'o //

original: de la aoo zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i don te /
analyzed: de la aoo zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i don te /
translated: Here, ao means the meaning of the Great Vehicle,

analyzed: yi ge 'bru bcu bzhi po mthar phyin pa'i don to //

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'ang de dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: mdo sde thams cad kyi nang na mthar phyin pa'i mchog yin pas aoo zhes bya'o //

analyzed: dang dngul la sogs pa rin po che thams cad gtong nus pas aam zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la aa: zhes bya ba ni theg pa mchog gi don to //
translated: In this case, aḥ means the meaning of the supreme vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di'ang mdo sde thams cad kyi nang na gtso bo dam pa /
translated: Because this Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra of the Great Vehicle is the most sublime and supreme among all sutras,

original: phul du gyur pas aa: zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phul du gyur pas aa: zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called aḥ.

original: de la ka zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la snying rje skye ba ste /
analyzed: de la ka zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la snying rje skye ba ste /
translated: In this case, ka means giving rise to compassion for all sentient beings.

analyzed: ji ltar sgra gcan 'dzin bzhin du sras su 'du shes shing dge ba'i don du 'gyur bas ka zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as in the case of Rāhula, one perceives them as one's own children and for the sake of their virtue, it is called ka.🔽 In this case, kha means to be free from all afflictions.

original: de la kha zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la kha zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Ka” means not a spiritual friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ma yin pa ni dme ba btsog pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ma yin pa ni dme ba btsog pa ste /
translated: Not a spiritual friend means a low-caste, filthy person.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la yid mi ches pas kha zhes bya'o /🔽de la ga zhes bya ba ni snying po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la yid mi ches pas kha zhes bya'o / de la ga zhes bya ba ni snying po'o //
translated: Because of not believing in the essence of the Tathāgata, it is called “ka.”🔽“Ga” means essence.

original: snying po zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po ste /
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i snying po ste /
translated: Essence means the secret essence of the Tathāgata.

original: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is called “the essence of the Tathāgata” and “the nature of the Buddha exists in all sentient beings.”

original: de ni ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ga zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “ga.”

original: de la gha zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de la gha zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i sgra'o //
translated: “Gha” is the sound of the permanence of the Tathāgata.

original: de la ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i sgra zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i sgra zhe na /
translated: What is the sound of the permanence of the Tathāgata?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa /
translated: The Tathāgata is permanent,

original: gnas pa / mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gnas pa / mi 'gyur /
translated: abiding, unchanging,

original: mi 'pho bas gha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'pho bas gha zhes bya'o //
translated: and not passing away. Therefore, it is called “gha.”

original: de la nga zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad zhig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la nga zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad zhig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: “ṅa” is the characteristic of the destruction of all conditioned things.

original: de bas na nga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nga zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “ṅa.”

original: de la tsa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i don te /
analyzed: de la tsa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i don te /
translated: “The syllable ca means ‘to cultivate.’

original: sems can thams cad gdul ba ni bsgom pa'i don @199b ces bya ste tsa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad gdul ba ni bsgom pa'i don @199b ces bya ste tsa zhes bya'o //
translated: To tame all sentient beings is the meaning of ‘to cultivate,’ and so it is called ca.🔽“The syllable cha means ‘to protect.’

original: de la tsha zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad la gdugs chen po ltar skyob cing khebs pas tsha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la tsha zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad la gdugs chen po ltar skyob cing khebs pas tsha zhes bya'o //
translated: The Thus-Gone One protects all sentient beings like a great parasol, and so it is called cha.

original: de la dza zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dza zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The syllable ja means ‘to be liberated.’

original: yang dag par rnam par grol ba rga ba'i mtshan nyid med pas dza zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rnam par grol ba rga ba'i mtshan nyid med pas dza zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the one who is perfectly liberated is free from the characteristics of aging, it is called ja.🔽“The syllable jha means ‘to be bound.’

original: de la dzha zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pas 'ching ba ni nags thibs po dang 'dra bas dzha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dzha zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pas 'ching ba ni nags thibs po dang 'dra bas dzha zhes bya'o //
translated: Since being bound by affliction is like a dense forest, it is called jha.

original: de la nya zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi don te /
analyzed: de la nya zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi don te /
translated: “The syllable ña means ‘to understand.’

original: yang dag pa'i chos nyid shes pas na nya zhes bya'o //🔽de la ta zhes bya ba ni dzambu'i gling du sku phyed bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos nyid shes pas na nya zhes bya'o // de la ta zhes bya ba ni dzambu'i gling du sku phyed bstan te /
translated: Since it is the understanding of the true nature of phenomena, it is called ña.🔽“The syllable ta means ‘to teach.’

original: chos bshad pa ni zla ba phyed lta bu yin pas ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos bshad pa ni zla ba phyed lta bu yin pas ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the Dharma is taught in Jambudvīpa for half the day, it is called ta.

original: de la tha zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa zla ba rgyas pa dang 'dra bas tha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la tha zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa zla ba rgyas pa dang 'dra bas tha zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, tha means the perfect dharmakāya, like a full moon, so it is called tha.

original: de la da zhes bya ba ni dge slong glen pa dag rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa mi shes te //
analyzed: de la da zhes bya ba ni dge slong glen pa dag rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa mi shes te //

original: pus pa chung du dang 'dra bas da zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pus pa chung du dang 'dra bas da zhes bya'o //
