original: de la dha zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi drin mi shes te /
analyzed: de la dha zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi drin mi shes te /
translated: Here, dha means not knowing the kindness of the master,

original: lus la sha zan dang 'dra bas dha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus la sha zan dang 'dra bas dha zhes bya'o //
translated: like flesh-eating on the body, so it is called dha.

original: de la na zhes bya ba ni 'gags pa'i don ma yin te //
analyzed: de la na zhes bya ba ni 'gags pa'i don ma yin te //
translated: Here, na does not mean the meaning of cessation,

original: mu stegs can lta bu yin pas na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can lta bu yin pas na zhes bya'o //
translated: like the tīrthikas, so it is called na.

original: de la ta zhes bya ba ni gnas gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la ta zhes bya ba ni gnas gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here, ta means the place where the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: kye dge slong dag 'jigs shing skrag pa spongs shig dang / khyed la dam pa'i chos bstan to zhes byung ba ni ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kye dge slong dag 'jigs shing skrag pa spongs shig dang / khyed la dam pa'i chos bstan to zhes byung ba ni ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Oh monks, abandon fear and terror, and I will teach you the sublime Dharma, so it is called ta.

original: de la tha zhes bya ba ni glen pa gti mug pa'i don te /
analyzed: de la tha zhes bya ba ni glen pa gti mug pa'i don te /
translated: Here, tha means the meaning of stupidity,

original: sems can 'khor bas rnam par glags te rnam par 'khor ba ni dar gyi srin bu'am /
analyzed: sems can 'khor bas rnam par glags te rnam par 'khor ba ni dar gyi srin bu'am /
translated: The sentient beings who are caught up in cyclic existence and revolve in cyclic existence are like silkworms or like insects,

original: @200a *// sbur ba lta bu yin pas tha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @200a *// sbur ba lta bu yin pas tha zhes bya'o //
translated: and so tha is the syllable.

original: de la da ni sbyin pa chen po byin pa ste /
analyzed: de la da ni sbyin pa chen po byin pa ste /
translated: In this regard, da is the great giving,

original: theg pa chen po yin pas da zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yin pas da zhes bya'o //
translated: and since it is the Great Vehicle, da is the syllable.

original: de la dha ni yon tan bsngags shing bstod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dha ni yon tan bsngags shing bstod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In this regard, dha is the praise and the eulogy of the qualities, and it is as follows:

original: dkon mchog gsum ni ri rab ri'i rgyal po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ni ri rab ri'i rgyal po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Three Jewels are like Mount Meru, the king of mountains,

original: shin tu bzang zhing mtho la yangs shing che bas rdib cing 'gyel ba med pas na dha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu bzang zhing mtho la yangs shing che bas rdib cing 'gyel ba med pas na dha zhes bya'o //
translated: and since they are extremely good, high, vast, and great, they are not crushed or destroyed, and so dha is the syllable.

original: de la na ni dkon mchog gsum rab tu brtan te /
analyzed: de la na ni dkon mchog gsum rab tu brtan te /
translated: In this regard, na is the Three Jewels being very firm,

original: sgo'i gtan pa dang 'dra bas mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgo'i gtan pa dang 'dra bas mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni na zhes bya'o //
translated: and since they are like the threshold of a door, they are called unmoving, and so na is the syllable.

original: de la pa ni phyin ci log gi don te /
analyzed: de la pa ni phyin ci log gi don te /
translated: In this regard, pa is the meaning of inverted,

original: gang 'di skad du dkon mchog gsum zad cing med par 'gyur ro zhes smra na /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du dkon mchog gsum zad cing med par 'gyur ro zhes smra na /
translated: and whoever says, The Three Jewels will be exhausted and will cease to exist,

original: de ni bdag bslus pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bdag bslus pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: should be known as one who is deceiving oneself.

original: de ni pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called pa.

original: de la pha ni 'jig rten gyi bgegs te /
analyzed: de la pha ni 'jig rten gyi bgegs te /
translated: “ Father” means the obstacles of the world.

original: 'jig rten na bskal pa 'byung ba'i tshe dkon mchog gsum yang med par 'gyur ro zhes smra na /
analyzed: 'jig rten na bskal pa 'byung ba'i tshe dkon mchog gsum yang med par 'gyur ro zhes smra na /
translated: In the world, when a kalpa arises, it is said that the Three Jewels will no longer exist.

original: de ni shin tu'ang glen zhing shes rab med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni shin tu'ang glen zhing shes rab med pa ste /
translated: This is extremely foolish and unwise.

original: 'phags pa la dbang za ba yin pas pha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa la dbang za ba yin pas pha zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is a challenge to the noble ones, it is called “father.”

original: de la ba ni sangs rgyas kyi stobs bcu yin pas ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ba ni sangs rgyas kyi stobs bcu yin pas ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “ Ba” means the ten powers of the Buddha.

original: de la bha ni khur lci ba khyer ba ste /
analyzed: de la bha ni khur lci ba khyer ba ste /
translated: “ Bha” means carrying a heavy burden.

original: bla na med pa'i yang dag pa'i chos phrag pa la bkur bzod pas de ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i yang dag pa'i chos phrag pa la bkur bzod pas de ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Since one can bear the unsurpassed true Dharma on one’s shoulders, one should know that one is a great bodhisattva.

original: bha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bha zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called bha.

original: de la ma ni shin tu sdom pa gnyan pa bcas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po ste /
analyzed: de la ma ni shin tu sdom pa gnyan pa bcas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po ste /
translated: “ Ma” means the extremely strict precepts of the Mahāyāna sūtras of the Great Parinirvāṇa.

original: ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ma.

original: de la ya ni byang @200b chub sems dpa' rnams gnas thams cad du sems can rnams la theg pa chen po'i chos ston pas ya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ya ni byang @200b chub sems dpa' rnams gnas thams cad du sems can rnams la theg pa chen po'i chos ston pas ya zhes bya'o //
translated: Ya is the bodhisattvas, who teach the Dharma of the Great Vehicle to sentient beings in all abodes, thus it is called ya.

original: de la ra ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yongs su bcom nas yang dag pa'i chos ston pas ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ra ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yongs su bcom nas yang dag pa'i chos ston pas ra zhes bya'o //
translated: Ra is the destruction of desire, anger, and ignorance, and the teaching of the true Dharma, thus it is called ra.

original: de la la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa can ni 'gyur ba mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa can ni 'gyur ba mi gnas pa ste /
translated: La is the non-abiding transformation of those in the Hearer Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po ni bstan pa mi g-yo bas nyan thos kyi theg pa spong zhing bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po la brtson pas la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni bstan pa mi g-yo bas nyan thos kyi theg pa spong zhing bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po la brtson pas la zhes bya'o //
translated: The Great Vehicle is unshakable, thus it abandons the Hearer Vehicle and strives in the unsurpassed Great Vehicle, thus it is called la.

original: de la wa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi phyir chos chen po'i char phab nas 'jig rten gyi rig sngags dang / yi ge dang / gtsug lag la sogs pa ni wa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la wa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi phyir chos chen po'i char phab nas 'jig rten gyi rig sngags dang / yi ge dang / gtsug lag la sogs pa ni wa zhes bya'o //
translated: Va is the Blessed Buddhas, who rain down the great Dharma for the sake of sentient beings, and the worldly mantras, letters, and treatises, etc., are va.

original: de la sha ni zug rngu rnam pa lnga yongs su spangs pas sha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sha ni zug rngu rnam pa lnga yongs su spangs pas sha zhes bya'o //
translated: Ṣa is the abandonment of the five kinds of afflictions, thus it is called ṣa.

original: de la sha ni don yongs su rdzogs pa ste; gang zhig yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa don chen po'i mdo mnyan na /
analyzed: de la sha ni don yongs su rdzogs pa ste; gang zhig yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa don chen po'i mdo mnyan na /
translated: If one listens to the sūtra of the great meaning of complete nirvāṇa,

original: de ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde thams cad thos shing 'dzin pas sha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde thams cad thos shing 'dzin pas sha zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “sha” because one hears and holds all the sūtras of the Great Vehicle.

original: de la sa ni sems can rnams la dam pa'i chos bstan te /🔽sems dga' bar gyur bas sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sa ni sems can rnams la dam pa'i chos bstan te / sems dga' bar gyur bas sa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Sa” means to teach the sacred Dharma to sentient beings.🔽Since the mind becomes joyful, it is called “sa.”

original: de la ha ni sems rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de la ha ni sems rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: “Ha” means to be extremely joyful.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'du byed thams cad dang bral ba ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'du byed thams cad dang bral ba ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: Bhagavān, it is amazing to be free from all compositional activity.

original: ae ma / de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das so zhes bya ba ni ha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ae ma / de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das so zhes bya ba ni ha zhes bya'o //
translated: “Ema! The Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa” is called “ha.”

original: de la kasha zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi don to //🔽tshad med pa'i bdud kyis de bzhin gsheg @201a *//
analyzed: de la kasha zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi don to // tshad med pa'i bdud kyis de bzhin gsheg @201a *//
translated: “Kṣa” means the meaning of Māra.

original: pa'i gsang ba'i snying po 'jig mi nus pas ksha zhes bya'o /
analyzed: pa'i gsang ba'i snying po 'jig mi nus pas ksha zhes bya'o /
translated: Since immeasurable Māras are unable to destroy the secret essence of the Tathāgata, it is called “kṣa.”

original: gzhan yang ksha ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su pha ma dang / chung ma dang / bu'i bar du bstan pas ksha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ksha ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su pha ma dang / chung ma dang / bu'i bar du bstan pas ksha zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, kṣa is taught as the father and mother following the worldly, up to the wife and children. Therefore, it is called kṣa.

original: de la ri r'i li l'i zhes bya ba'i yi ge bzhi po 'di ni don rnam pa bzhi'o /
analyzed: de la ri r'i li l'i zhes bya ba'i yi ge bzhi po 'di ni don rnam pa bzhi'o /
translated: Here, the four syllables ri rā li lā have four meanings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / gnyen po'i chos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / gnyen po'i chos so //
translated: the Buddha, the Dharma, the Saṅgha, and the Dharma of antidotes.

original: de la gnyen po'i chos ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su lha sbyin ltar dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa dang / tshul khrims bcab pa'i phyir gzugs dang cha lugs rnam pa sna tshogs bstan kyang mkhas pa shes rab can ni khong du chud pas de la mi 'jigs te /
analyzed: de la gnyen po'i chos ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su lha sbyin ltar dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa dang / tshul khrims bcab pa'i phyir gzugs dang cha lugs rnam pa sna tshogs bstan kyang mkhas pa shes rab can ni khong du chud pas de la mi 'jigs te /
translated: Here, the Dharma of antidotes is the division of the Saṅgha, like Devadatta, and the concealment of morality. Although various forms and appearances are shown following the worldly, the wise and the wise understand it and are not afraid of it.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pas de'i phyir na ri r'i li l'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pas de'i phyir na ri r'i li l'i zhes bya'o //
translated: This is following the worldly. Therefore, it is called ri rā li lā.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / lce'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbugs ring thung dang / 'dren pa las sgra'i rjes su don shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / lce'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbugs ring thung dang / 'dren pa las sgra'i rjes su don shes par 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the letters is also the exhalation and inhalation of the breath, the tongue faculty, the length and shortness of the breath, and the understanding of the meaning that follows the sound of the inhalation and exhalation of the breath.

original: de'ang lce dang so las rnam pa tha dad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'ang lce dang so las rnam pa tha dad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the letters are distinguished by the tongue and the teeth.

original: de ltar yi ge'i don 'di ni sems can dag gi ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yi ge'i don 'di ni sems can dag gi ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the meaning of the letters is the pure verbal action of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge la ltos pas /
analyzed: sems can gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge la ltos pas /
translated: The buddha nature of sentient beings depends on the letters.

original: gdod yongs su dag par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gdod yongs su dag par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is originally pure.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rang bzhin gyis thog ma nas rnam par dag pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi nang na gnas kyang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched lta bu ni ma yin no /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis thog ma nas rnam par dag pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi nang na gnas kyang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched lta bu ni ma yin no /
translated: Because it is pure from the beginning by nature, it abides within the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, but it is not like the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: @201b de bas na sems can dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: @201b de bas na sems can dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, sentient beings should go for refuge to the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir sems can thams cad la khyad par med par mnyam par lta'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir sems can thams cad la khyad par med par mnyam par lta'o //
translated: Because of the nature of the Buddha, one views all sentient beings as equal, without distinction.

original: de bas na yi ge phyed po ni mdo sde dang / gtsug lag dang / smra ba dang / tshig gis rnam par rgyal ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge phyed po ni mdo sde dang / gtsug lag dang / smra ba dang / tshig gis rnam par rgyal ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this half-syllable is the root of victory over the sūtras, treatises, speech, and words.

original: yi ge phyed po'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa kun gyi smra ba'i rtsa ba yin pas yi ge phyed ces bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge phyed po'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa kun gyi smra ba'i rtsa ba yin pas yi ge phyed ces bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the half-syllable is called half because it is the root of speech for all afflictions.

original: yi ge rdzogs pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad smra ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge rdzogs pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad smra ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The complete syllable is the root of speech for all virtuous dharmas.

original: dper na / 'jig rten na gang sdig pa mi dge ba byed pa ni skyes bu phyed ces bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / 'jig rten na gang sdig pa mi dge ba byed pa ni skyes bu phyed ces bya'o //
translated: For example, in the world, one who commits evil and non-virtue is called a half-man.

original: dge ba kun spyod pa ni rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba kun spyod pa ni rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who practices all that is virtuous is called complete.

original: de ltar na mdo sde dang / gtsug lag dang / smra ba thams cad ni yi ge phyed po'i rtsa bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de ltar na mdo sde dang / gtsug lag dang / smra ba thams cad ni yi ge phyed po'i rtsa bar 'gyur ro /
translated: Thus, all sūtras, treatises, and speech become the root of the half-syllable.

original: de la gang zhig 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa dang / yang dag par rnam par grol ba'ang yi ge phyed po'i nang du 'jug ces smra na de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gang zhig 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa dang / yang dag par rnam par grol ba'ang yi ge phyed po'i nang du 'jug ces smra na de lta ma yin no //
translated: Someone might say, ‘The Tathāgata and perfect liberation are included in the half-syllable.’ But that is not so.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is free from syllables.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad la ma thogs ma chags te /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad la ma thogs ma chags te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is unobstructed and unattached to all phenomena.

original: yang dag par rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: yang dag par rnam par grol lo //
translated: He is perfectly liberated.

original: de la yi ge'i don rtogs shing shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yi ge'i don rtogs shing shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meaning of the syllable that is understood and known?

original: gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du gshegs nas yi ge phyed po med par byas pa shes na /
analyzed: gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du gshegs nas yi ge phyed po med par byas pa shes na /
translated: If one knows that the Tathāgata, having come into the world, has made the half-syllable nonexistent,

original: de ni yi ge'i don shes shing rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yi ge'i don shes shing rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called understanding and knowing the meaning of the syllable.

original: gang yi ge phyed po'i don gyi rjes su 'jug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin mi shes pa'o //🔽de la yi @202a *//
analyzed: gang yi ge phyed po'i don gyi rjes su 'jug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin mi shes pa'o // de la yi @202a *//
translated: Those who follow the meaning of the half-syllable do not know the nature of the Tathāgata.

original: ge med pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: ge med pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meaning of the syllable that is nonexistent?

original: gang mi dge ba'i chos la bsnyen cing spyod pa de ni yi ge med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang mi dge ba'i chos la bsnyen cing spyod pa de ni yi ge med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To approach and practice nonvirtuous dharmas is called ‘no letters.’

original: gzhan yang yi ge med pa ni dge ba'i chos la bsnyen cing spyod kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang yi ge med pa ni dge ba'i chos la bsnyen cing spyod kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'am /
translated: “Moreover, no letters means to approach and practice virtuous dharmas but not to know whether the Tathāgata is permanent

original: mi rtag gam /🔽ther zug gam /
analyzed: mi rtag gam / ther zug gam /
translated: or impermanent,🔽whether he is eternal

original: ther zug ma yin pa mi shes /
analyzed: ther zug ma yin pa mi shes /
translated: or not eternal,

original: chos dang dge 'dun yang mi shes /
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun yang mi shes /
translated: whether he is the Dharma or the Saṅgha,

original: 'dul ba dang 'dul ba ma yin pa dang / mdo sde dang mdo sde ma yin pa dang / bdud kyis bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa mi shes te /
analyzed: 'dul ba dang 'dul ba ma yin pa dang / mdo sde dang mdo sde ma yin pa dang / bdud kyis bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa mi shes te /
translated: whether he is the Vinaya or not the Vinaya, whether he is a sūtra or not a sūtra, whether he is taught by Māra or taught by the Buddha.

original: bye brag mi phyed pa de ni yi ge med pa'i don la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag mi phyed pa de ni yi ge med pa'i don la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not distinguishing these is called ‘engaging in the meaning of no letters.’

original: de ltar na ngas yi ge med pa'i don gyi rjes su 'jug pa'ang ngas bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar na ngas yi ge med pa'i don gyi rjes su 'jug pa'ang ngas bshad do //
translated: Thus, I have explained engaging in the meaning of no letters.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de bas na khyed kyis yi ge phyed po spangs te /
analyzed: de bas na khyed kyis yi ge phyed po spangs te /
translated: therefore you should abandon half-letters

original: yi ge rdzogs pa la shin tu mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge rdzogs pa la shin tu mkhas par bya'o //
translated: and become very skilled in complete letters.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Buddha:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “World-honored One,

original: bdag cag gis yi ge'i grangs la shin tu mkhas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis yi ge'i grangs la shin tu mkhas par bgyi'o //
translated: we should become very skilled in the enumeration of letters.

original: bdag cag gis ston pa bla na med pa dang mjal bas de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i bka' bzhin du bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis ston pa bla na med pa dang mjal bas de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i bka' bzhin du bgyi'o //
translated: Since we have met with the unsurpassed teacher, we should do as the Tathāgata has taught.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said to the Bodhisattva Kāśyapa:

original: legs so // legs so /
analyzed: legs so // legs so /
translated: “Excellent, excellent!

original: gang dam pa'i chos bsnyen par 'dod pa dag de bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dam pa'i chos bsnyen par 'dod pa dag de bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
translated: Those who wish to approach the true Dharma should train in this way.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od @202b srung la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od @202b srung la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Buddha said to the Bodhisattva Kāśyapa:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: bya'i nang na bya ka landa ka dang / bya ngur pa ni gar song yang mi 'bral te lhan cig go /
analyzed: bya'i nang na bya ka landa ka dang / bya ngur pa ni gar song yang mi 'bral te lhan cig go /
translated: Among birds, the kalaviṅka and the goose are inseparable wherever they go.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa'ang de dang 'dra ste mi 'bral lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa'ang de dang 'dra ste mi 'bral lo //
translated: Likewise, suffering, impermanence, and no-self are also like this and cannot be separated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /

translated: and because they are afflicted, they do not see that they have the nature of the buddhas.

original: de bas na ngas bdag med pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ngas bdag med pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, I have taught what is called “selflessness.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'phrul gyi mig med pa dag bdag ces bya ba yang dag pa ni mi shes kyi /
analyzed: 'phrul gyi mig med pa dag bdag ces bya ba yang dag pa ni mi shes kyi /
translated: Those who do not have the eye of discernment do not know the true “self.”

original: bla dvags su bdag ces bya ba 'dzin pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'dus byas la rnam par 'du byed de /
analyzed: bla dvags su bdag ces bya ba 'dzin pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'dus byas la rnam par 'du byed de /
translated: The self is a designation, and so, due to the power of afflictions, one engages in conditioned activities.

original: mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called impermanence.

original: de bas na ngas rtag pa'i chos kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: de bas na ngas rtag pa'i chos kyang gzhan la /
translated: Therefore, I have explained that the dharma of permanence is one thing,

original: mi rtag pa'i chos kyang gzhan zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos kyang gzhan zhes bshad do //
translated: and the dharma of impermanence is another.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: dpa' zhing rtsol nus pa dag ni //🔽ri yi rtse mo la 'dug gam //
analyzed: dpa' zhing rtsol nus pa dag ni // ri yi rtse mo la 'dug gam //
translated: Those who are courageous and capable,🔽whether they are on mountain peaks,

original: thang ngam dgon pa gar gnas kyang //
analyzed: thang ngam dgon pa gar gnas kyang //
translated: plains, or in the wilderness,

original: byis pa ma rabs rtag tu mthong //
analyzed: byis pa ma rabs rtag tu mthong //
translated: always see the childish and vulgar.

original: ye shes chen po'i gnas phyin te //
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i gnas phyin te //
translated: Having reached the abode of great wisdom,

original: bla na med pa'i stegs 'dzegs na //🔽bdag gi mya ngan kun sel bas //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i stegs 'dzegs na // bdag gi mya ngan kun sel bas //
translated: and ascended the unsurpassed staircase,🔽they dispel all their own suffering

original: sems can kun gyi mya ngan mthong //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi mya ngan mthong //
translated: and see the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom nas ye shes kyi ri bo la bzhugs pas so so'i skye bo thams cad ni rtag tu tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pas rnam par gzir bar gzigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom nas ye shes kyi ri bo la bzhugs pas so so'i skye bo thams cad ni rtag tu tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pas rnam par gzir bar gzigs so //
translated: The Thus-Come One has conquered all the afflictions of countless sentient beings and abides on the mountain of wisdom, while all ordinary beings are constantly oppressed by countless afflictions.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa ltar ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa ltar ma lags so //
translated: Bhagavān, it is not as you have said in verse.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mya ngan @208a *//
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mya ngan @208a *//
translated: In nirvāṇa there is no sorrow,

original: zhes bgyi ba'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba'ang ma mchis /
translated: and there is no joy.

original: dga' ba'ang ma mchis na ci'i slad du ye shes kyi stegs la 'dzegs pa dang / ri'i rtse mo lta bur phyin pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'ang ma mchis na ci'i slad du ye shes kyi stegs la 'dzegs pa dang / ri'i rtse mo lta bur phyin pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: Why then do you say that it is like climbing the raft of wisdom and reaching the peak of the mountain,

original: sems can thams cad mthong ngo zhes gsungs /
analyzed: sems can thams cad mthong ngo zhes gsungs /
translated: and that one sees all sentient beings?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ye shes kyi stegs ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi stegs ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya'o //
translated: The “causeway of wisdom” refers to nirvana.

original: mya ngan med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //🔽mya ngan dang bcas pa ni byis pa ma rabs rnams so //
analyzed: mya ngan med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o // mya ngan dang bcas pa ni byis pa ma rabs rnams so //
translated: “Devoid of sorrow” refers to the Tathāgata.🔽“Sorrowful” refers to the foolish worldlings.

original: byis pa ma rabs ni mya ngan dang bcas pa /
analyzed: byis pa ma rabs ni mya ngan dang bcas pa /
translated: The foolish worldlings are sorrowful,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mya ngan med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mya ngan med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: while the Tathāgata is said to be devoid of sorrow.

original: ri rab kyi rtse mo zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: ri rab kyi rtse mo zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: “Summit of Mount Sumeru” refers to perfect liberation.

original: gang brtson 'grus la 'bad pa ni ri rab lhun po lta bu ste /
analyzed: gang brtson 'grus la 'bad pa ni ri rab lhun po lta bu ste /
translated: Those who strive with perseverance are like Mount Sumeru,

original: mi g-yo mi ldeg pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo mi ldeg pa'o //
translated: unmoving and unshakable.

original: sa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyis rnam par 'du byed pa ste /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyis rnam par 'du byed pa ste /
translated: “Earth” refers to the conditioned, to the formations.

original: byis pa ma rabs dag ni sa de la gnas nas 'dus byas la rnam par 'du byed do //
analyzed: byis pa ma rabs dag ni sa de la gnas nas 'dus byas la rnam par 'du byed do //
translated: The foolish worldlings, dwelling on that earth, form the conditioned.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can dag ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can dag ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: The wise and the learned are those who have attained full enlightenment.

original: yod pa rnam par spangs nas rtag pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa rnam par spangs nas rtag pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having abandoned existence, they are permanent. Therefore they are called Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni so so'i skye bo tshad med pa dag srid pa'i zug rngus zug pa la thugs brtse ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la mya ngan yod ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni so so'i skye bo tshad med pa dag srid pa'i zug rngus zug pa la thugs brtse ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la mya ngan yod ces bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has compassion for the immeasurable number of ordinary beings who are tormented by the pain of existence, and so it is said that the Tathāgata has sorrow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “World-Honored One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: World-Honored One,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la mya ngan mnga' na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la mya ngan mnga' na /
translated: if the Tathāgata has sorrow,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes gdags @208b su mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes gdags @208b su mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not appropriate to call him a Perfectly Awakened One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Buddha told Kāśyapa:

original: de'ang don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'ang don med pa ma yin te /
translated: “This is not meaningless.

original: so so'i skye bo gang dang gang gis 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dang de dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba ston to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo gang dang gang gis 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dang de dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata manifests birth in whatever way is necessary to tame any ordinary being.

original: skye ba ston mod kyi yang dag par skye ba med de /
analyzed: skye ba ston mod kyi yang dag par skye ba med de /
translated: Although he manifests birth, he is not truly born.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa gnas pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa gnas pa'i chos can te /
translated: Therefore the Tathāgata is eternal and unchanging,

original: ka landa ka dang bya ngur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ka landa ka dang bya ngur pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a kalaviṅka bird or a cuckoo.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it is like this:

original: dper na / gang zag dag zla ba sprin gyis chod de mi snang na /
analyzed: dper na / gang zag dag zla ba sprin gyis chod de mi snang na /
translated: For example, when a person sees the moon obscured by clouds and not shining,

original: zla ba nub bo snyam sems te /
analyzed: zla ba nub bo snyam sems te /
translated: he thinks, “The moon has set.”

original: yang dag par na zla ba la nub pa med do //
analyzed: yang dag par na zla ba la nub pa med do //
translated: But in reality, the moon has not set.

original: gling gzhan du shar ba na de na gnas pa'i sems can dag ni zla ba shar ro snyam sems te /
analyzed: gling gzhan du shar ba na de na gnas pa'i sems can dag ni zla ba shar ro snyam sems te /
translated: When it rises in another continent, the sentient beings who live there think, “The moon has risen.”

original: yang dag pa na zla ba la shar pa med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa na zla ba la shar pa med do //
translated: But in reality, the moon has not risen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ri rab lhun pos bsgribs te mi snang gi /🔽zla ba la shar ba'am /
analyzed: ri rab lhun pos bsgribs te mi snang gi / zla ba la shar ba'am /
translated: It is because it is obscured by Mount Sumeru and does not shine,🔽but it is not that the moon has risen

original: nub pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: nub pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: or set.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Perfectly Awakened One, is also like that.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gshegs pa dzambu'i gling du pha dang ma'ang yod par bstan nas /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gshegs pa dzambu'i gling du pha dang ma'ang yod par bstan nas /
translated: He appears in the world in the great trichiliocosm, and in Jambudvīpa he shows having a father and mother.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dzambu'i gling du 'byung ngo snyam sems so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dzambu'i gling du 'byung ngo snyam sems so //
translated: Ordinary beings think, “The Tathāgata appears in Jambudvīpa.”

original: dzambu'i gling du mya ngan las 'das pa'ang bstan te /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling du mya ngan las 'das pa'ang bstan te /
translated: He also demonstrated the attainment of nirvana in Jambudvipa.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par mya ngan las 'das pa med kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par mya ngan las 'das pa med kyang /
translated: The Tathagata is not truly in nirvana.

original: sems can dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das so snyam sems te /🔽ji ltar zla ba nub pa'i dpe bshad @209a *//
analyzed: sems can dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das so snyam sems te / ji ltar zla ba nub pa'i dpe bshad @209a *//
translated: Sentient beings think, 'The Tathagata has entered nirvana.'

original: pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the example of the setting moon.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la'ang yang dag par na skye ba dang 'gog pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la'ang yang dag par na skye ba dang 'gog pa med de /
translated: The Tathagata himself is not truly born or extinguished.

original: sems can gdul ba'i phyir skye ba dang / 'gog pa bstan to //
analyzed: sems can gdul ba'i phyir skye ba dang / 'gog pa bstan to //
translated: In order to tame sentient beings, he demonstrates birth and extinction.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: dper na / zla ba khams 'di dag tu yongs su rgyas par snang na khams gzhan du phyed du snang ngo //
analyzed: dper na / zla ba khams 'di dag tu yongs su rgyas par snang na khams gzhan du phyed du snang ngo //
translated: For example, when the moon appears full in this realm, in other realms it appears half.

original: khams 'di na phyed du snang na khams gzhan na rgyas par snang ngo //
analyzed: khams 'di na phyed du snang na khams gzhan na rgyas par snang ngo //
translated: When it appears half in this realm, in other realms it appears full.

original: dzambu'i gling gi mi dag zla ba thog ma shar ba mthong na tshes gcig ces zer te /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling gi mi dag zla ba thog ma shar ba mthong na tshes gcig ces zer te /
translated: When the people of Jambudvipa see the moon rising, they say 'the first day.'

original: zla ba tshes pa'i 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: zla ba tshes pa'i 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: They give rise to the perception of the moon's waxing.

original: zla ba rgyas shing gang ba mthong na tshes bco lnga zhes zer te /
analyzed: zla ba rgyas shing gang ba mthong na tshes bco lnga zhes zer te /
translated: When they see the full moon, they say, ‘The fifteenth day of the month has arrived.’

original: zla ba rgyas pa'i 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: zla ba rgyas pa'i 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: They think of the moon as waxing.

original: yang dag par na zla ba nyid la ni skye ba dang 'bri ba med de /
analyzed: yang dag par na zla ba nyid la ni skye ba dang 'bri ba med de /
translated: In reality, the moon itself does not wax.

original: ri rab lhun po'i dbang gis ni skye ba dang 'dri ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: ri rab lhun po'i dbang gis ni skye ba dang 'dri ba'ang yod do //
translated: It is because of Mount Sumeru that the moon appears to wax and wane.

original: rigs kyi bu; de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Son of good family! The Tathāgata is also like this.

original: dzambu'i gling 'dir thog ma skye ba'ang bstan /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling 'dir thog ma skye ba'ang bstan /
translated: He manifests birth in this Jambudvīpa

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang bstan te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang bstan te /
translated: and manifests nirvāṇa.

original: thog ma skye ba bstan pa ni zla ba tshes pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: thog ma skye ba bstan pa ni zla ba tshes pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The manifestation of birth is like the moon on the first day of the month.

original: thams cad kyis gzhon nu thog ma btsas nas gom pa bdun por ba na tshes gnyis kyi zla ba lta bur sems so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis gzhon nu thog ma btsas nas gom pa bdun por ba na tshes gnyis kyi zla ba lta bur sems so //
translated: Everyone thinks of the newborn infant taking seven steps as being like the moon on the second day.

original: de nas gzhon nu slob pa la zhugs pa bstan pa na tshes gsum gyi zla ba lta bur sems so //
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu slob pa la zhugs pa bstan pa na tshes gsum gyi zla ba lta bur sems so //
translated: Then, when he manifests learning, they think of him as being like the moon on the third day.

original: rab tu byung ba bstan pa na tshes brgyad kyi zla ba lta bur sems so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba bstan pa na tshes brgyad kyi zla ba lta bur sems so //
translated: When he manifests going forth, they think of him as being like the moon on the eighth day.

original: ye shes kyi 'od chen po btang nas sems can tshad med pa dang bdud mang po btul ba na @209b tshes bco lnga'i zla ba rgyas pa lta bur sems so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'od chen po btang nas sems can tshad med pa dang bdud mang po btul ba na @209b tshes bco lnga'i zla ba rgyas pa lta bur sems so //
translated: When he emits the great light of wisdom and subdues countless sentient beings and many demons, he is like the full moon on the fifteenth day.

original: gzhan yang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus yongs su brgyan pa mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa na zla ba bri ba lta bur sems so //
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus yongs su brgyan pa mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa na zla ba bri ba lta bur sems so //
translated: When he displays nirvana, adorned with the thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks, he is like the waning moon.

original: de ltar sems can dag ni mthong ba mi 'dra ste /🔽la las ni zla ba phyed ral du mthong /
analyzed: de ltar sems can dag ni mthong ba mi 'dra ste / la las ni zla ba phyed ral du mthong /
translated: Thus, sentient beings see him differently.🔽Some see him as half-formed,

original: la las ni zla ba rgyas par mthong /
analyzed: la las ni zla ba rgyas par mthong /
translated: some see him as full,

original: la las ni zla ba 'bri bar mthong ste /
analyzed: la las ni zla ba 'bri bar mthong ste /
translated: and some see him as waning.

original: zla ba'i rang bzhin la ni yang dag par na skye ba dang 'bri ba med de /
analyzed: zla ba'i rang bzhin la ni yang dag par na skye ba dang 'bri ba med de /
translated: But in reality, the moon has no arising or waning.

original: rtag tu rgyas shing gang ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyas shing gang ngo //
translated: It is always full and complete.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is also like this.

original: de bas na rtag pa gnas pa mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa gnas pa mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the eternal, abiding, unchanging one.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: It is also like this:

original: dper na / zla ba rgyas pa ni gnas gang dang gang du grong khyer ram /
analyzed: dper na / zla ba rgyas pa ni gnas gang dang gang du grong khyer ram /
translated: For example, wherever the full moon appears, in the cities or in the countryside,
